translation:
vt. & vi. 与…作战; 争斗
n. 战争，战役; 比赛，较量; 长期论战或长期作战; 激烈的竞争

时态：battled, battling, battles
分布：战斗(93%)，争斗(6%)，与 ... 竞争(1%)


→词源同beat, 击，打。-le, 表反复。
战斗(batt+le)[bat=beat,表示"打,击"]
n.战役,战斗;斗争v.战斗,斗争,搏斗The pattern of the battery doesn't matter to the battle against the little brittle cattle.电池的式样对与脆小牛作战无关要紧.



US ['bætˌ-] noun countable  IMPROVER  ■a fight between armed forces 战斗，战役，战争
•the Battle of the Somme索姆河战役

•Her only brother was killed in battle (= while fighting).她唯一的哥哥在战斗中牺牲了。
 IMPROVER  ■an argument between two groups or against a situation that a group wants to change 争论；斗争
•The aid agency continues the battle against ignorance and superstition.该援助机构持续对抗愚昧和迷信。

•The battle for women's rights still goes on.争取妇女权利的斗争还在继续进行。

UK ['bæt.l] US ['bætˌ-] noun countable battle of wits ■when two people or two groups use their intelligence and ability to think quickly to try to defeat each other 斗智，智慧的较量
UK ['bæt.l] US ['bætˌ-] noun countable do battle ■to fight or argue in a serious way 开战，交战；斗争；辩论
•No agreement was reached and both sides prepared to do battle.双方没有达成协议，准备开战。

UK ['bæt.l] US ['bætˌ-] verb intransitive  ADVANCED  ■to fight 作战，战斗
•Twenty years ago this summer, police battled with residents in this inner city area for three days.20年前的这个夏天，员警与该内城区的居民发生了持续三天的冲突。

•For years the two nations battled over territory.多年来，两国一直为领土问题发生冲突。
 ADVANCED  ■to try hard to achieve something in a difficult situation 斗争，奋斗
•He had to battle against prejudice to get a job.他为求找到一份工作，不得不与偏见斗争。

•The parents battled for the right to be involved in the decision-making.家长们为取得参与决策的权利而抗争。

•We battled with the elements to get the roof fixed.我们顶着恶劣的天气修葺屋顶。





battle, fight, struggle, combat, campaign, warfare, war, engagement

这组词都有“战斗，战争”的意思，其区别是：
battle: 侧重指战争中的一次较全面、时间较长的战斗，也指陆军或海军在某一特定地区进行的战斗，或个人之间的争斗。
fight: 最普通用词，含义广，指战斗、斗争或打斗。
struggle: 指激烈或时间持续长的战斗或奋力斗争。
combat: 泛指军事行动，尤指小规模的战斗，甚至是格斗。
campaign: 通常指在一场大的战争中在某一地区进行的一连串有既定目的的军事行动。也可作引申用。
warfare: 侧重指战争状态或具体的作战方法。
war: 是战争的总称，一般指包括多个战役的大规模战争。
engagement: 指交战，交火。


n. 战役；斗争
 - war, conflict, campaign
vi. 斗争；作战
 - campaign, fight, war
examples: 英 ['bætl] 美 ['bætl]
n.战斗；争斗v.与 ... 作战；与 ... 竞争
(1) His brave deeds in the battle earned him everlasting glory.(2) He has proved his wit in the battle.(3) They battled with the wind and the waves.(4) Progress is slow but we keep battling on.
(1) 他在那场战斗中的英勇事迹为他赢得了永恒的荣誉。(2) 他已在这场争斗中证明了自己的睿智。(3) 他们与风浪搏斗。(4) 进展虽慢
[sound:youdao-363c2c32-b83f9d64-f550a928-cceff5fa-02ef5f1a.mp3]

translation:
n. 湾，海湾; 犬吠声; 月桂树; 吊窗，凸窗
vi. （尤指猎犬等）吠，叫，咆哮; 筑堤遏（水）; 穷追，使陷入绝境; 阻止（敌人）不使前进
adj. 赤褐色的，栗色的
vt. 向…吠叫

时态：bayed, baying, bays
分布：海湾(86%)，月桂树(6%)，哀号(2%)，红棕色(2%)，嗥叫(2%)，隔间(1%)，犬吠(1%)


→1.海湾，词源不详。
n.海湾,(港)湾"The gay mayor maybe lay in the hay by the Baby bay," he says in dismay.他沮丧地说:"快活的市长大概躺在婴儿湾边上的干草中."



noun countable COAST  海滨   ADVANCED  ■a part of the coast where the land curves in so that the sea is surrounded by land on three sides 湾，海湾
•We sailed into a beautiful, secluded bay.我们驶进了一个美丽、僻静的海湾 。

•Dublin Bay都柏林湾

•the Bay of Naples那不勒斯海湾

[beɪ] noun countable SPACE  空间  ■a partly surrounded or marked space 间隔区，限定区域
•Visitors must park their cars in the marked bays.来访者必须把车停在划定的区域内。
⇒ See also sickbay
[beɪ] noun countable TREE  树  (also bay tree) ■a small evergreen (= never losing its leaves) tree which has leaves that are used to add flavour to cooking 月桂树
[beɪ] noun countable HORSE  马  ■a brown horse 栗色马
[beɪ] noun countable hold/keep sth/sb at bay ■to prevent someone or something unpleasant from harming you 阻止，遏制（令人不快的事物）
•Exercise can help keep fat at bay.锻炼身体有助于防止变胖。

[beɪ] noun countable at bay ■If an animal is at bay, it is about to be caught or attacked. （动物）被包围，走投无路
[beɪ] verb intransitive ■(of dogs and wolves) to make a low and long deep cry repeatedly （狗或狼）叫，吠
[beɪ] verb intransitive bay for blood disapproving ■If a group of people are baying for blood, they want someone to be hurt or punished 要求暴力相向；要求惩罚（某人）
•By now the crowd was baying for blood.此时，人群在大声要求惩罚相关人等。





bay, gulf

这两个名词均有“海湾”之意。
bay: 指海岸线上一大块凹入的地方，是港口的所在地。
gulf: 一般比bay大，但比sea小。指大片深入到陆地中，由海岸围绕成半圆形的海水区域。


n. [地理] 海湾；狗吠声
 - gulf, bight
vi. 吠叫；大声叫嚷
 - rant and rave
examples: 英 [beɪ] 美 [beɪ]
n.海湾；月桂树；隔间；犬吠；【计】机架，底板vi.嗥叫；哀号adj.红棕色

(1) Sunlight shimmers on the waters of the bay.(2) We can see a magical view over the calm water of the bay from our window.(3) In the milk was a bay leaf, a few slices of onion.(4) In the library, the books on history are all kept in one bay.(5) There is a storage bay in the house.(6) We heard the distant bay of the hounds.(7) He is baying at the moon.(8) I heard the baying cry of a wolf.(9) It takes us a great deal of money to bay this new house.
(1) 阳光在海湾的水面上闪烁。(2) 从我们的窗户里可以看到海湾里平静海水的迷人景色。(3) 牛奶中也有一片月桂树叶和几片洋葱。(4) 在图书馆里，历史方面的书都放在同一隔间里。(5) 屋内有一个隔开的储藏间。(6) 我们听到远处一群猎犬的吠声。(7) 他朝着月亮吠叫。(8) 我听过狼的哀嚎。(9) 买这套新房子花掉我们很多钱。
[sound:youdao-ba92c7f4-1cdec18a-68115059-d47e1f7c-de7da556.mp3]

translation:
v. 是; 有，存在; 做，成为; 发生
aux. 用来表示某人或某物即主语本身，用来表示某人或某物属于某一群体或有某种性质

时态：was, been, being, is
分布：是(48%)，在(20%)，有(20%)，到达(6%)，拜访(6%)


→来自PIE *bheue , 存在，生产，将要，同源词包括future, physics。
v.(就)是,等于;(存)在;到达,来到,发生He will be happy in the future.他将来会幸福的.



(being, was, were, been)verb DESCRIPTION  描述   ESSENTIAL  [L] ■used to say something about a person, thing or state, to show a permanent or temporary quality, state, job, etc. （用来说明人、事物或状态，表示性质、状态、工作等）
•He is rich.他很富有。

•It's cold today.今天很冷。

•I'm Andy.我叫安迪。

•That's all for now.到此为止。

•What do you want to be (= What job do you want to do) when you grow up?你长大后想做甚么？

•These books are (= cost) 50p each.这些书每本50便士。

•Being afraid of the dark, she always slept with the light on.她怕黑，总是开着灯睡觉。

•Never having been ill himself, he wasn't a sympathetic listener.他自己从未生过病，所以听到别人的病情时，并不怎么同情。

•Be quiet!安静！

•Do be quiet!一定要保持安静！

•[+ -ing verb] The problem is deciding what to do.问题在于要决定做甚么。

•[+ to infinitive] The hardest part will be to find a replacement.最困难的就是找个人代替。

•[+ that] The general feeling is that she should be asked to leave.大家普遍认为她应该被辞退。

•It 's not  that I don't like her - it 's just  that we rarely agree on anything!我并不是不喜欢她，只是我们的看法不尽相同！
 ESSENTIAL  intransitive usually + adverb or preposition ■used to show the position of a person or thing in space or time （表示时间或方位）
•The food was already on the table.食物已经放在桌上了。

•Is anyone there?那里有人吗？

•The meeting is now (= will happen) next Tuesday.会议将于下周二召开。

•There 's a hair in my soup.我的汤里有一根头发。
 ESSENTIAL  [L] ■used to show what something is made of 由…组成（或制成）
•Is this plate pure gold?这个碟子是纯金的吗？

[strong form bi:] [weak form bi] [bɪ] (being, was, were, been)verb ALLOW  允许  [+ to infinitive] ■used to say that someone should or must do something 应该，必须
•You're to sit in the corner and keep quiet.你要坐在角落里，保持安静。

•Their mother said they were not to (= not allowed to) play near the river.妈妈告诉他们不准在河边玩。

•There's no money left - what are we to do?没有钱了——我们该怎么办？

[strong form bi:] [weak form bi] [bɪ] (being, was, were, been)verb FUTURE  将来  [+ to infinitive] formal ■used to show that something will happen in the future 将，将要
•We are to (= We are going to) visit Australia in the spring.我们将在春天前往澳大利亚。

•She was never to see (= She never saw) her brother again.她此后再也没有见过她的弟弟。
[+ to infinitive] ■used in conditional sentences to say what might happen （用于条件句中，表示可能）万一，假如
•If I were to refuse they'd be very annoyed.如果我拒绝，他们会很气恼的。

•formal Were I to refuse they'd be very annoyed.倘若我拒绝，他们会很气恼的。

[strong form bi:] [weak form bi] [bɪ] (being, was, were, been)verb CAN  能够  [+ to infinitive] ■used to say what can happen 能够
•The exhibition of modern prints is currently to be seen at the City Gallery.现在在市立美术馆可以参观现代版画展。

[strong form bi:] [weak form bi] [bɪ] (being, was, were, been)verb EXIST  存在     intransitive ■to exist or live 存在，生存
•formal Such terrible suffering should never be.这种苦难绝不应该存在的。

•old use OR literary By the time the letter reached them their sister had ceased to be (= died).当他们收到信件时，他们的姐姐已经去世了。

[strong form bi:] [weak form bi] [bɪ] (being, was, were, been)verb   Phrasal Verbs   be in for sth ■to be going to experience something unpleasant very soon 即将遭遇…
•The weather forecast says we're in for heavy rain this evening.天气报告说，这边今晚将有大雨。

•You'll be in for it (= She will be very angry) if you don't do what she tells you.如果你不照她说的去做，她会大为光火的。

[strong form bi:] [weak form bi] [bɪ] (being, was, were, been)verb   Common Learner Errors   beWarning:  Check your verb endings!Many learners make mistakes when using be  in the -ing form.Don't write 'beeing', write being.
[strong form bi:] [weak form bi] [bɪ] (being, was, were, been)auxiliary verb CONTINUE  继续   ESSENTIAL  [+ -ing verb] ■used with the present participle of other verbs to describe actions that are or were still continuing （与动词的现在分词连用，表示动作正在进行）正在，在
•I'm still eating.我还在吃饭。

•She's studying to be a lawyer.她在学习，将来想成为律师。

•The audience clearly wasn't enjoying the show.观众显然不喜欢这个节目。

•You're always complaining.你总是在抱怨。

•I'll be coming back (= I plan to come back) on Tuesday.我将于周二回来。

[strong form bi:] [weak form bi] [bɪ] (being, was, were, been)auxiliary verb PASSIVE  被动   ESSENTIAL  [+ past participle] ■used with the past participle of other verbs to form the passive （与动词的过去分词连用，表示被动）被
•I'd like to go but I haven't been ask ed.我倒是想去，但没有邀请我。

•Troublemakers are encourag ed to leave.闹事者被力劝赶快离开。

•A body has been discover ed by the police.员警发现了一具尸体。





exist, live, be

这组词都有“存在”的意思，其区别是：
exist: 通常指可观察到的或众所周知的存在现象。
live: 多指有生命的东西的存在。指无生命事物时，强调可联想起生命的那些特点。
be: 指某时某地确存在的事物或现象，多与there连用。


prep. 在，存在；是
 - at
examples: 英 [bi] 美 [bi]
v.有；在；是；到达；拜访

(1) It is necessary that he be sent there at once.(2) There will be rain in all parts of the country.(3) A successful businessman must be aggressive.(4) She has been in her room for hours.(5) The concert will be in the school hall.(6) They are college students.(7) It promised to be a difficult job.(8) It will be a large church wedding.(9) I'll be on my way very soon.(10) They were supposed to be here an hour ago.(11) He has been there at least twice.
(1) 有必要马上派他到那里去。(2) 全国各地将有雨。(3) 一个成功的商人必须有进取心。(4) 她在自己的房间里待了几个小时。(5) 音乐会将在学校的礼堂内举行。(6) 他们是大学生。(7) 看来这是一项困难的任务。(8) 那将是一次大型的教堂式婚礼。(9) 我很快就要上路.(10) 他们应该在一小时以前到达这里。(11) 他至少去过那儿两次。
[sound:youdao-b22962d0-4cf98887-dbc4bd72-0b297db7-77a6ba57.mp3]

translation:
n. 海滩，海滨; 岸上的沙子和卵石
vt. 将…拖上岸; 将滑艇拖到小屋前面的岸边

时态：beached, beaching, beaches
分布：海滩(68%)，沙滩(23%)，海滨(9%)


→词源不详，原义表示小石子。
n.海滩,湖滩,河滩Each pea and peach on the beach can be reached by the peacock.海滩上的每一颗豌豆和桃子孔雀都能触及.



noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■an area of sand or small stones near the sea or another area of water such as a lake 海滨，湖滨；海滩，沙滩
•We spent the day on the beach.我们在海滩渡过了一整天。

•a beach café海滨咖啡厅

•a beach towel沙滩浴巾

[bi:tʃ] noun countable   Common Learner Errors   beachWarning:  use the correct preposition!Don't say 'in the beach', say on the beach :✗ We spent the whole day playing in the beach.
[bi:tʃ] verb transitive ■to pull or force a boat, etc. out of the water onto the shore 把船从水里拖到岸上
•The boat had been beached near the rocks.船已经被拖到了礁石附近。





shore, bank, seaside, beach, coast

这组词都有“岸”的意思，其区别是：
shore: 指紧靠大湖泊或海洋的陆地边缘或靠海的休养地。
bank: 多指有一定坡度的河岸、湖岸或堤岸。
seaside: 尤指疗养地、游览地区的海边。
beach: 指倾斜度小，被海、湖或河水冲刷而有沙或卵石积存的地方。
coast: 地理学上的名词，专指被视为边界的沿海陆地的尽头。


n. [海洋] 海滩；湖滨
 - seabeach, foreshore
vi. 搁浅；定居
 - take the ground, make one's pitch
examples: 英 [biːtʃ] 美 [biːtʃ]
n.海滩；海滨；沙滩vt.拖(船)上岸

(1) We are basking on the beach.(2) They walked along the beach talking and laughing.(3) They are vacationing at the beach.(4) I prefer a sandy beach to a shingle one.(5) He beached the rowboat in front of the cabin.
(1) 我们在海滩上晒太阳。(2) 他们说说笑笑，沿着海滩散步。(3) 他们正在海滨度假。(4) 我喜欢沙滩，不喜欢遍布小石子的海滩。(5) 他将滑艇拖到小屋前面的岸边。
[sound:youdao-72bb8dce-49fc5dab-426e87c2-feaac36d-4d7d7515.mp3]

translation:
n. 梁，栋梁; 束; 光线; （电波的）波束
vi. 发出光与热; 面露喜色
vt. 播送; 以梁支撑; 用…照射; 流露
vt. & vi. 笑容满面，眉开眼笑; 发射电波，播送; 放出束状的光（或热）

时态：beamed, beaming, beams
分布：光线(45%)，发射(21%)，播送(14%)，桁条(7%)，微笑(5%)，发光(5%)，用梁支撑(3%)


→词源同be, 生长，存在，此处指长成柱子。笑容来自柱子的比喻义，笑容如明亮的光线束。
n.(横)梁,桁条;(光线的)束,柱v.微笑The football team stopped the steam stream with beams.足球队用横杆堵住了蒸汽流.



noun countable LINE  线  ■a line of light that shines from a bright object 光线；光束；光柱
•We could just pick out the path in the weak beam of the UK usuallytorch/ USflashlight.我们借着手电筒微弱的光线，仅能勉强认清路。

•The rabbit stopped, mesmerized by the beam of the car's headlights.兔子被汽车车前大灯射出的光束迷住了眼，停了下来。
⇒ See also moonbeam;sunbeam■a line of radiation or particles flowing in one direction （定向发出的）射束，粒子流
•a laser beam雷射光束

•an electron beam电波

[bi:m] noun countable WOOD  木头  ■a long thick piece of wood, metal or concrete, especially used to support weight in a building or other structure （尤指支撑建筑物或其他结构的）梁，桁架，栋梁
•The sitting room had exposed wooden beams.客厅顶上的木梁露出来了。
the beam ■in the sport of women's gymnastics , a wooden bar on which the competitors balance and perform movements （女子体操运动中的）平衡木
[bi:m] verb SMILE  微笑  intransitive ■to smile with obvious pleasure 高兴的微笑，眉开眼笑
•She beamed with delight/pleasure at his remarks.她听完他的话，高兴得眉开眼笑。

•The child beamed at his teacher as he received the award.那个孩子在领奖时对他的老师报以微笑。

•[+ speech] "I'm so pleased to see you, " he beamed (= said as he smiled).“很高兴见到你，”他微笑着说。

[bi:m] verb SEND OUT  发送  intransitive or transitive ■to send out a beam of light, or an electrical or radio signal, etc. 辐射；发光；闪光；发射电波；播送
•The midday sun beamed (= shone brightly) down on the boat as it drifted along.正午的阳光照在缓缓漂动的船上。

•The concert was beamed (= broadcast) by satellite all over the world.演唱会经卫星转播到世界各地。





giggle, laugh, chuckle, roar, sneer, beam, jeer, grin

这组词都有“笑”的意思，其区别是：
giggle: v.咯咯地笑，痴笑，傻笑，多指女人和孩子由于紧张、被逗乐、尴尬时所发出的笑声。
 • The schoolgirls giggled when the famous football player walkedsintostheir classroom.   当这个著名的足球运动员走进教室时，女生们都咯咯地笑起来。
laugh: v.笑，大笑，用于一般的笑或出声的大笑。
chuckle: v. (书面语)吃吃的笑，抿嘴笑，轻声笑，多指因得意或领会到某事中的趣味而暗自发笑。
 • She does not laugh out loud; she only chuckles.   她没有笑出声来，只是抿嘴而笑。
roar: v.怒吼，咆哮，引申为放声大笑，哄堂大笑。
 • He roared when he heard the joke.   听完这个笑话，他哈哈大笑。
sneer: v.冷笑，嘲笑，指以语言、表情、和声调表示轻蔑或嘲弄。
 • He sneered at the offer and said it was two low.   他对报价嗤之以鼻，说它太低了。
beam: v.本义指照耀，放光，引申为"微笑"，是正式用语，指面带喜悦或笑容，暗示对他人的友好或内心的满足。
 • She beamed with happiness.   她高兴得眉开眼笑。
jeer: v.讥笑，嘲笑，其同义词是mock。
 • The crowd jeered when the boxer was knocked down.   当那个拳手被人打倒时，人群开始嘲笑他。
grin: v.露齿而笑，指人因高兴、满足、轻蔑等咧开嘴露齿地笑。
 • He grinned at his mother.   他冲他的妈妈咧嘴一笑。



laugh, smile, siggle, grin, beam, sneer

这些动词均含“笑”之意。
laugh: 最常用词，指因喜悦、愉快或轻视而出声的笑或大笑。
smile: 指面露微笑，侧重于无声。
siggle: 指发出咯咯的笑声，较多地用于女人或孩子。
grin: 指露齿而笑。
beam: 书面用词，指人因心情舒畅而发出的笑，即喜形于色地笑。
sneer: 指冷笑、嘲笑。


n. [建] 横梁；光线；电波； [船] 船宽； [计量] 秤杆
 - ray, stream
vt. 发送；以梁支撑；用…照射；流露
 - to transmit, send out
vi. 照射；堆满笑容
 - irradiate
examples: 英 [biːm] 美 [biːm]
vi.微笑；发光vt.播送；发射；用梁支撑n.桁条；光线；(光线的)束；(横)梁

(1) She beamed at me.(2) His face(He) is beaming with delight.(3) From a sky of untarnished blue the sun beamed down upon Beijing.(4) Television began beaming the national nominating conventions into the homes of Americans.(5) This is a programme beamed at Japan.(6) I beamed my flashlight into the corner and saw a mouse.(7) The transmitter will be beamed at Africa.(8) A rotary table helps to optimize the beam incidence angle.(9) A through beam illuminated the dark road ahead.(10) A ns pulse beam device is installed at pulse beam current piping.(11) He struck the beam with his head.(12) If you hit your head on that beam,you'll know it.

(1) 她对我微笑。(2) 他高兴得笑容满面。(3) 阳光透过万里碧空照耀着北京城。(4) 电视开始向美国家庭播放总统候选人全国提名大会的情况。(5) 这是对日本广播的节目。(6) 我把手电照向墙角,看见一只老鼠。(7) 这台发射机将用于对非洲广播。(8) 一张旋转的桌子有助于将光线影响之方式角最佳化。(9) 一束透射光照亮了前方黑暗的道路。(10) 在脉冲束流管道上安装有强流毫微秒脉冲化聚束装置。(11) 他的头撞到梁上了。(12) 头要是撞到梁上去了，就有你的好受。
[sound:youdao-f1c1885d-fe96b04b-79a46fa7-ad409fa2-1a6f8f7a.mp3]

n. 豆; 豆形种子; 毫无价值的东西
vt. 将（球）击中击球员头部
int. 胡说！呸！不可能！

分布：豆(96%)，豆科植物(4%)


→词源不详。
n.豆;菜豆,蚕豆The lean man leans on the clean bean plant to read a leaf leaflet.瘦人斜靠在干净的豆科植物上读叶片传单.



noun countable  ADVANCED  ■a seed, or the pod containing seeds, of various climbing plants, eaten as a vegetable 豆；豆荚；菜豆；豆科植物
•green beans四季豆

•French beans四季豆

•baked beans焗豆

•Coffee beans are the bean-like seeds of the coffee tree.咖啡豆是咖啡树结的豆形种子。

[bi:n] noun countable not have a bean informal ■to have no money 一文不值



n. [植] 豆；嘴峰；毫无价值的东西
 - legumen, nihil
examples: 英 [biːn] 美 [biːn]
n.豆；豆科植物
(1) Cocoa bean is used to make some kinds of drink.(2) A bean grows rapidly.(3) The bean plant is cultivated for animal fodder.
(1) 可可豆用于制作一些饮料。(2) 豆类植物生长很快。(3) 种植豆科植物可以用来当动物饲料。

translation:
n. 熊; （在证券市场等）卖空的人; 蛮横的人
vt. 忍受; 承担; 支撑; 生育
vi. 生（孩子）; 结（果实）; 与…有关
adj. 跌价的; 股票行情下跌的; 卖空者的

时态：bore, born, bearing, bears
分布：熊(82%)，忍受(14%)，结果(3%)，负荷(1%)


→1.承受，来自PIE *bher(1), 承受，带来，生育，同bring.
n.熊v.忍受,容忍;负担;结果实,生子女Next year the bearded bear will bear a dear baby in the rear.明年,长胡子的熊将在后方产一头可爱的小崽.



US [ber] verb (bore, borne or  US ALSO  born)ACCEPT  接受   IMPROVER  transitive ■to accept, tolerate or endure especially something unpleasant 忍受；容忍；经受；承担
•The strain must have been enormous but she bore it well.当时压力一定很大，但她承受得了。

•Tell me now! I can't bear the suspense !现在告诉我吧！ 我等不及了！

•It's your decision - you must bear the responsibility if things go wrong.是你作出的决定——如果出了差错，你必须承担责任。

•[+ to infinitive] He couldn't bear to see the dog in pain.他不忍看见狗那么痛苦。

•[+ -ing verb] I can't bear being bored.我受不了闲极无聊的日子。
not bear thinking about ■to be too unpleasant or frightening to think about （糟糕或可怕得）不敢想像
•"What if she'd been travelling any faster?" "It doesn't bear thinking about."“假如她驾车再快一点，那会怎么样？”“简直不敢想像。”

UK [beər] US [ber] verb (bore, borne or  US ALSO  born)KEEP  保留   ADVANCED  transitive ■to have or continue to have something 具有，带有
•Their baby bears a  strong  resemblance/an uncanny likeness to its grandfather.他们的宝宝长得非常／不可思议地像他的爷爷。

•The stone plaque bearing his name was smashed to pieces.上面刻有他名字的石匾被砸得粉碎。

•On display were boxing gloves which bore Rocky Marciano's signature.展品中有洛奇‧马西亚诺签名的拳击手套。

•[+ two objects] I don't bear them any ill feeling (= I do not continue to be angry with or dislike them).我并不怨恨他们。

•Thank you for your advice, I'll bear it in mind (= will remember and consider it).谢谢你的忠告，我会谨记在心的。

UK [beər] US [ber] verb (bore, borne or  US ALSO  born)SUPPORT  支撑  transitive ■to hold or support something 负载，负担，负荷
•The chair, too fragile to bear her weight , collapsed.椅子太不结实了，她一坐上去就垮了。

UK [beər] US [ber] verb (bore, borne or  US ALSO  born)PRODUCE  产生  transitive formal ■to give birth to young, or (of a tree or plant) to give or produce especially fruit or flowers 生（孩子）；结（果实）；开（花）
•She had borne six children by the time she was thirty.她到30岁时已经生了六个孩子。

•[+ two objects] When his wife bore him a child he could not hide his delight.他的妻子生了个小孩时，他掩饰不住内心的喜悦。

•Most animals bear their young in the spring.大多数动物都在春天繁殖后代。

•The pear tree they planted has never borne fruit.他们种的梨树从来没有结过梨。

UK [beər] US [ber] verb (bore, borne or  US ALSO  born)BRING  携带  transitive slightly formal ■to carry and move something to a place 携带；运送
•At Christmas the family descend on the house bearing gifts.圣诞节时，全家人带着礼物来到那幢房子。

•Countless waiters bore trays of drinks into the room.很多侍者端着一盘盘的饮品进入房间。

•The sound of the ice-cream van was borne into the office on the wind.雪糕车的叮当声随风飘进了办公室。

UK [beər] US [ber] verb (bore, borne or  US ALSO  born)CHANGE DIRECTION  改变方向  intransitive usually + adverb or preposition ■to change direction slightly so that you are going in a particular direction 转向
•The path followed the coastline for several miles, then bore inland.这条小路沿着海岸线延伸了几英里，然后转向内陆。

•After you go past the church keep bearing left/right.经过教堂后，继续向左／右。

UK [beər] US [ber] verb (bore, borne or  US ALSO  born)SAY  说明  bear testimony/witness formal ■to say you know from your own experience that something happened or is true 见证，作证
•She bore witness to his patience and diligence.她亲眼见证了他的耐心和勤奋。
■If something bears testimony to a fact, it proves that it is true 证明
•The iron bridge bears testimony to the skills developed in that era.这座铁桥证明了那个时代的技术发展水准。
bear false witness old use ■to lie 撒谎
UK [beər] US [ber] verb (bore, borne or  US ALSO  born)bear fruit formal ■If something someone does bears fruit, it produces successful results 有成果，获得成功
•Eventually her efforts bore fruit and she got the job she wanted.她的努力终于有成果，得到了想要的工作。

UK [beər] US [ber] verb (bore, borne or  US ALSO  born)bear the scars ■to still suffer emotional pain from something unpleasant that happened in the past 伤痛未平
UK [beər] US [ber] verb (bore, borne or  US ALSO  born)  Phrasal Verbs   bear down on sb/sth ■to move in a threatening way towards someone or something 冲向…，向…逼近
•I looked up to see the car bearing down on me我一抬头，看见那车辆正向我冲过来。

UK [beər] US [ber] verb (bore, borne or  US ALSO  born)  Phrasal Verbs   bear in on/upon UK formal ■If something is borne in on/upon someone, they are made to understand it 认清，某事被认识到，某人不得不明白
•Suddenly it was borne in on him that he was becoming too old to start a new career.他突然意识到自己已经太老了，不适合开创新的事业。

UK [beər] US [ber] verb (bore, borne or  US ALSO  born)  Phrasal Verbs   bear on sth slightly formal ■to be connected or related to; to influence 与…有关系；对…有影响
•I don't see how that information bears on this case.我不明白那些资料跟这宗案件有甚么关系。

UK [beər] US [ber] verb (bore, borne or  US ALSO  born)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] bear sb/sth out ■to support the truth of something 为…作证，证明，证实
•His version of events just isn't borne out by the facts.他对事件的说法并未得到证实。

•If you tell them what happened I will bear you out (on it).如果你告诉他们所发生的事，我会为你作证的。

UK [beər] US [ber] verb (bore, borne or  US ALSO  born)  Phrasal Verbs   bear up ■to deal with a very sad or difficult situation in a brave and determined way 勇敢地支撑下去，咬紧牙关坚持
•"How has she been since the funeral?" "Oh, she's bearing up."“葬礼后她怎样了？”“哦，她一直在挺着。”

UK [beər] US [ber] verb (bore, borne or  US ALSO  born)  Phrasal Verbs   bear with sb ■to be patient and wait while someone does something 耐心等候（某人）；容忍（某人）
•If you'll just bear with me for a moment , I'll find you a copy of the drawings.请你等我一下，我去替你找一份这些图案的副本。

UK [beər] US [ber] noun countable ANIMAL  动物   ADVANCED  ■a large, strong wild mammal with a thick fur coat that lives especially in colder parts of Europe, Asia and North America 熊
•a brown/black bear棕熊／黑熊

•a bear cub (= young bear)幼熊
⇒ See also grizzly bear;polar bear;teddy
UK [beər] US [ber] noun countable FINANCE  金融  specialized■a person who sells shares when prices are expected to fall, in order to make a profit by buying them back again at a lower price （股市中）做空头者，预期股市行情看跌的人 Compare bull
UK [beər] US [ber] noun countable be like a bear with a sore head (US also like a (real) bear) informal ■to be in a bad mood which causes you to treat other people badly and complain a lot 脾气暴躁；情绪不好
•You're like a bear with a sore head this morning. What's wrong with you?你怎么了？ 今天早上脾气很暴躁。

UK [beər] US [ber] noun countable  Do bears shit in the woods ? saying humorous or offensive ■used to say that the answer to a question you have just been asked is obviously 'yes' 这还用问吗？（当然是啦！）




withstand, bear, tolerate, stand, endure

这些词都表忍受，忍耐。
withstand: 经受，承受，指顶住外来的压力和攻势。如：They have withstood all test.(他们经受了一切考验。)
bear: 忍受，容忍，指忍受使人悲痛、烦恼或痛苦的事情。如：It is hard to bear to be laughed at.(被人取笑是难以忍受的。)
tolerate: 容忍，容许，指自我克制的态度，对于令人反感的事没有任何抗议。如：I can’t tolerate him if he goes on like that. (他如果继续这样下去的话，我决不会容忍他。)
stand: 忍受，与bear同义，但较口语化。如：She can’t stand having nothing to do.(没事干，她受不了。)
endure: 忍耐，书面语，指长时间经受痛苦而不屈服。如：It takes patience to endure hardships. 忍受苦难需要耐力。)


vi. 承受；结果实
 - fruit
vt. 忍受；具有；支撑
 - support, stomach, go, stand, abide
n. [脊椎] 熊
 - Bruin
examples: 英 [beə(r)] 美 [ber]
n.熊v.忍受；负荷；结果；证实；生子女

(1) The hunter slashed at the bear with his knife.(2) The bear has lived up to his reputation for stupidity.(3) I can't bear young people casting away their youth.(4) Girls whom can get easily may be hard to bear.(5) The shelf, too weak to bear all the books, collapsed.(6) They will bud and blossom and bear fruit.(7) "A-bomb, H-bomb and nuclear-powered submarine"(8) He was born to an affluent family.(9) It is said that wisdom is born with a man.
(1) 猎人挥刀向熊猛烈砍去。(2) 这只熊果然名不虚传，笨得出奇。(3) 我无法忍受年轻人虚掷青春。(4) 容易追求的女子,也许很难忍受。(5) 架子太不结实了，无法负荷所有的书，就被压塌了。(6) 它们将萌芽,开花和结果。(7) 两弹一艇(8) 他生在富裕人家。(9) 有人说智慧是与生俱来的。
[sound:youdao-ed5cb064-03a87877-c7968d6d-67c68fd8-e8274be2.mp3]

translation:
n. 胡须; [虫]口鬃，[动]颌毛; （牡蛎等的）鳃; [植]芒
vt. 使有胡须（颌毛，芒刺）; 抓（捋）住…的胡子，拔…的胡子; 公然反对，勇敢地对抗

时态：bearded, bearding, beards
分布：胡须(97%)，公开反对(2%)，抓住胡须(1%)


→来自拉丁词barba，胡子，词源同barber.
n.胡须Next year the bearded bear will bear a dear baby in the rear.明年,长胡子的熊将在后方产一头可爱的小崽.



US [bɪrd] noun countable  ADVANCED  ■the hair that some men allow to grow on the lower part of their face （下巴上的）胡须
•a flowing white beard飘逸的白胡须

•He's growing a beard.他在留胡子。

•He shaved off his beard but kept his moustache.他剃了下巴上的胡须，但保留了嘴唇上面的胡子。
■the long hair that grows under a goat 's mouth 山羊胡
UK [bɪəd] US [bɪrd] verb transitive literary ■to face, meet or deal with an unpleasant or frightening person in a brave or determined way 勇敢面对（某人），公然反抗（某人）
•With a nervous swallow he bearded the formidable-looking librarian behind the desk.他紧张地咽了咽口水，鼓起了勇气，看着桌子后面那个凶神恶煞般的图书管理员。

UK [bɪəd] US [bɪrd] verb transitive literary  beard the lion (in his/her den) ■to visit an important person in the place where they work, in order to tell or ask them something unpleasant 太岁头上动土；老虎嘴里拔牙



vt. 公然反对；抓…的胡须
 - speak out against
n. [解剖] 胡须；颌毛
 - hige, barba
examples: 英 [bɪəd] 美 [bɪrd]
n.胡须vt.公开反对；抓住胡须

(1) Why don't you shave your beard off?(2) To my great amusement his false beard fell off.(3) He thought I was not brave enough to beard him, but he was wrong because I did it.(4) He bearded his boss and demanded an explanation.
(1) 你怎麽不把胡子刮掉?(2) 使我感到极其好笑的是他的假胡子掉下来了。(3) 他以为我没有那么大勇气向他挑战，但是他错了，我就这么做了。(4) 他公然蔑视上司，并要求他作出解释。

translation:
n. 野兽; 人面兽心的人; 讨厌的人（或事物）; 老顽固，坏蛋

分布：兽(95%)，畜牲(5%)


→来自拉丁词bestia, 野兽，同bestial, 狂野的。
n.兽,牲畜;凶残的人,举止粗鲁的人On the eastern Easter feast, at least one beast's breasts were tested with yeast.在东部复活节宴会上,至少有一头牲畜的乳房被用酵母做了试验.



noun countable formal ■an animal, especially a large or wild one （尤指大型或野生的）动物；野兽
•a wild beast野兽

•The room wasn't fit for man or beast.这个房间根本就住不了。
■old-fashioned ■an unpleasant, annoying or cruel person 粗暴（或卑劣、凶残）的人
•He was a beast to her throughout their marriage.结婚后，他一直对她很粗暴。

[bi:st] noun countable beast of burden literary ■an animal such as a donkey or an ox which is used to carry or pull things 役畜（如驴、牛等）




beast, brute, creature, cattle, animal

这组词都有“动物”的意思，其区别是：
beast: 指有别于爬行动物、昆虫等的较大的四脚兽类或牛、马等牲畜。
brute: 特指野兽。用于人时，突出其野蛮或残忍。
creature: 通常指生物或动物，与非生动相对。指人时，则含怜悯或轻蔑的意味。
cattle: 指大牲畜，尤其指牛。
animal: 普通用词，指区别于植物和矿物而言的动物的总称。


n. 野兽；畜生，人面兽心的人
 - wild animals, subman
examples: 英 [biːst] 美 [biːst]
n.兽；畜牲
(1) The lion is called the king of beasts.(2) The hunters blocked up the hole of the beast.(3) He put the beast out and headed home.
(1) 狮子号称百兽之王。(2) 猎人堵住了兽穴。(3) 他把这只畜牲丢下，掉头就回家。
[sound:youdao-c62d79df-14deec50-8068bca9-d9fa0312-6abee61c.mp3]

translation:
vi. （心脏等）跳动; 搜索; （风、雨等）吹打; （鼓）咚咚地响
vt. & vi. 接连地击打
vt. 打败; 敲打; 控制; 避免
n. 节拍; （鼓的）一击; 管区
adj. [美国口语]大吃一惊的; [常作 B-]“反传统一代”成员的; 摇滚音乐的; [口语]（体力或情绪上）疲劳不堪的

时态：beat, beaten, beating, beats
分布：打(62%)，跳动(10%)，拍子(9%)，打败(9%)，战胜(5%)，敲打(4%)，精疲力尽的(1%)


→来自PIE *bhau, bhat, 击，打。同bat, batter, butt.
n.敲打;(心脏等)跳动v.打败;(心脏等)跳动With my own ears I clearly heard the heart beat of the nuclear bomb.我亲耳清楚地听到原子弹的心脏的跳动.
【参】beater（n 搅拌器）



verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat)DEFEAT  打败   ESSENTIAL  transitive ■to defeat or do better than 打败，战胜
•Simon always beats me at tennis.西蒙在打网球时总是赢我。

•Holland beat Belgium (by)3-1.荷兰队以3比1战胜比利时队。

•Our team was comfortably/easily/soundly beaten in the first round of the competition.在第一轮比赛中，我们队被对手轻易地／毫不费力地／彻底打败了。

•The nationalists were narrowly beaten in the local election.民族主义者在地方选举中以些微差距落败。

•He beat me fair and square (= without cheating).他光明磊落地击败了我。

•They were beaten hands down (= completely) by their opponents.他们被对手彻底打败了。

•She has beaten her own record of three minutes ten seconds.她打破了自己创下的3分10秒纪录。

•US He beat out all the top competitors in his sport.他击败了该项目中所有的顶尖运动员。
■informalto be more enjoyable than another activity or experience （非正式）指比另一活动或经历更加有乐趣
•[+ -ing verb] Taking the bus sure beats walking.坐公车当然比走路好。

•slang Taking the bus beats the hell out of (= is much better than) walking all the way there.坐公车比一路走到那里要好得多。

•You can't beat (= there is nothing more enjoyable than) a cold beer on a hot afternoon.在炎热的下午，没有甚么比喝上一杯冰镇啤酒更舒爽的了。
transitive ■To beat something that is going to happen is to take action before the thing happens 对…采取预防措施，避免
•Let's try to beat the traffic problems by leaving early in the morning.我们在早上尽量早点出门，以避开交通挤塞。

•I always do my shopping early to beat the rush.我总是很早就去购物，以避开交通繁忙的时段。
beat sb to it ■to do something before someone else does it 比（某人）先下手，比（某人）抢先做
•I was just going to tidy up the kitchen, but you've beaten me to it.我刚准备打扫厨房，你已经抢先做完了。

[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat)HIT  打   ADVANCED  intransitive or transitive [usually + adv/prep] ■to hit repeatedly （接连地）打，击
•They saw him beating his dog with a stick.他们看见他用棍子打他的狗。

•The child had been brutally/savagely beaten.孩子遭到毒打。

•She was beaten to death.她被活活打死了。

•[+ obj + adj] He was beaten senseless.他被打昏了。

•Beat the drum.打起鼓来。

•The rain was beating down incessantly on the tin roof.雨点不断地打在铁皮屋顶上。
beat a path through sth ■to form a path in an area where long grass or bushes grow closely together, by hitting the plants with your hands or an object, or by stepping on them 在…中开出一条路；在…中开辟道路
•We beat a path through the undergrowth.我们在矮树丛中开辟出一条路来。

[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat)MIX  混和  ■to mix something repeatedly using a utensil such as a spoon or whisk 搅打，不断搅拌（用如调羹或搅拌器等器具）
•To make an omelette you must first beat the eggs.要做英式煎蛋，必须先把鸡蛋打匀。

[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat)MOVEMENT  移动  intransitive or transitive ■to (cause to) make a regular movement or sound （使）跳动；使拍打；敲打
•The doctor could feel no pulse beating.医生感觉不到脉搏的跳动。

•The hummingbird beats its wings at great speed.蜂鸟高速振动翅膀。
beat time ■to make a regular sound or movement to music 打拍子
[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat) beat sb at their own game ■to use to your own advantage the methods by which someone else has tried to defeat you 以其人之道还治其人之身
[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat)beat sb  hollow UK Australian ■to defeat someone easily and by a large amount 轻易击败某人，取得压倒性胜利
•We played my brother's school at football and beat them hollow.在足球比赛中我们大败了我兄弟的学校。

[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat)beat sb's brains out informal ■to hit someone repeatedly with great force 反复重击（某人）
[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat)beat your breast/chest ■to show how sad or guilty you feel in an obvious or public way 捶胸顿足
•There's no point in beating your breast about losing the money - you won't get it back.丢了钱捶胸顿足也于事无补——无法把钱找回来的。

[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat)beat a path to sb's door ■to be eager to buy or get something from someone 急切地想从（某人）处购买（或得到）
•I tried to sell my old bike by advertising it in the local paper, but I didn't have a lot of people beating a path to my door.我想在当地报章上登广告，卖掉我的旧脚踏车，可是没有多少人联络我。

[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat)beat a retreat (also beat your retreat) ■to run away from a dangerous or unpleasant situation 仓皇撤退，匆匆离开
•When we saw the police arriving we beat a hasty retreat.我们看见员警来了，就急忙溜走。

[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat)beat around the bush (UK also beat about the bush) ■to avoid talking about what is important （说话）转弯抹角，兜圈子
•Don't beat around the bush - get to the point!别在兜圈子——直接说出重点吧！

[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat)Beat it! slang ■Go away! 走开！
[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat)beat the rap US ■to escape or avoid blame or punishment 逃脱责任；逃避惩罚
[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat) If you can't beat 'em, join 'em. saying ■said when you accept that you cannot be as successful as someone else without doing what they do although you do not approve or agree with it 跟着大队走吧。
[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat)it beats me (also what beats me) slang ■said when you do not understand a situation or someone's behaviour 我不理解，我不明白
•It beats me how she got the job.我不明白她是怎样得到这份工作的。

•What beats me is why she stays with him.我不理解她为甚么跟他在一起。

[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat)take some beating ■If something will take some beating, it is so good that it is hard to improve on it 难以超越
•Green's new world record will take some beating.格林新创下的世界纪录将很难打破。

[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat)that beats everything (US also that beats all) slang ■expression showing great surprise （表示非常惊讶）真是从未发生过的怪事
•You mean she just left her job without telling anyone she was going? Well, that beats everything!你是说她刚刚离职，却没有告诉任何人她要走了？哦，这可真是一件怪事！

[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] beat sth/sb back ■If you beat back someone or something dangerous, you use force to move them away from you 击退，逐回
•Riot police beat back the crowds of demonstrators.防暴员警把示威人群逐退了。

[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat)  Phrasal Verbs   beat down ■If the sun beats down, it shines very strongly and makes the air very hot 曝晒
•The tropical sun beat down on them mercilessly.热带阳光猛烈地照射在他们身上。

[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] beat sb down informal ■to persuade someone to accept a lower amount of money for something 说服（某人）减价；杀价
•He wanted £50 for the bike, but I managed to beat him down to £35.这架脚踏车他出价50英镑，但我设法让他减价（至35英镑）。

[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] beat sb off ■to manage to defeat someone who is attacking you 击退，打退，击败（某人）
•She beat off her attacker by hitting him with her handbag.她挥舞着手提包，把那个袭击者打退了。
■2. figurative The company managed to beat off the competition and secure the contract.
beat 1	 公司设法打败了竞争者，取得了合同。
[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat)  Phrasal Verbs   beat off US offensive ■to masturbate  手淫
[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] beat sth out MUSIC  ■to make sounds that have a particular rhythm by hitting something such as a drum 打拍子；用鼓拍打出节拍；用敲打伴奏
•The drummer beat out a steady rhythm while we marched.我们随着鼓手打出的稳健节拍大步前进。
FIRE  ■to make a fire go out by hitting it repeatedly with an object, such as a large piece of cloth （用毯子等）扑灭（火）
•She beat the flames out with her bare hands.她赤手空拳，把大火扑灭。

[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] beat sb out mainly US ■to defeat someone or do better than them in a competition, sport or business 战胜，打败（某人）
•They beat out several other rivals for the contract.他们打败几个对手后，取得了合约。

[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat)  Phrasal Verbs   beat sth out of sb ■to make someone say things they do not want to by hitting them 拷打（某人）逼供
•The men claimed that the police had beaten the confession out of them.这些人声称，他们的供词是警方刑讯期间逼供出来的。

[bi:t] verb (beat, beaten or  US ALSO  beat)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] beat sb up informal ■to hurt someone badly by hitting or kicking them again and again 殴打，虐待（某人）
•He claims he was beaten up by the police.他声称遭警方殴打。

[bi:t] adjective [after verb] informal ■extremely tired 疲乏的
•I'm beat - I'm going to bed.我很累，要去睡觉了。

•UK You've been working too hard, you look dead beat.你最近工作太辛苦了，看起来非常疲惫。
⇒ See also deadbeat
[bi:t] noun MOVEMENT  移动   ADVANCED  countable or uncountable ■a regular movement or sound, especially that made by your heart （尤指心脏）连续的跳动（声）
•I put my head on his chest but I could feel no heart beat.我把头贴近他的胸口，但感觉不到他的心跳。

•My heart missed a beat (= I felt very excited) when she said, "Yes, I'll marry you".当她说出“是的，我愿意嫁给你”时，我激动得心跳停了一下。

[bi:t] noun MUSIC  音乐   ADVANCED  countable or uncountable ■in music, a regular emphasis, or a place in the music where such an emphasis is expected （音乐的）节拍，拍子
•The guitar comes in on the third beat.吉他在第三拍加入。

•Make sure you play on the beat (= on the beats).表演时一定要跟上节拍。

•He tapped his foot to the beat (= rhythm) of the music.他的脚随着音乐的节拍，轻轻地打着拍子。

[bi:t] noun AREA  区域  countable usually singular ■an area for which someone, such as a police officer, has responsibility as part of their job （巡警的）巡逻区域；工作区域
•Bob has worked as an officer on this particular beat for 20 years.鲍勃当上警官，在这个区域里已经巡逻了20年。
be on/walking the beat ■A police officer who is on/walking the beat is on duty, walking around rather than driving in a police car. （巡警）在步行巡逻




strike, beat, hit, thrash, whip

这组词都有“打”的意思，其区别是：
strike: 普通用词，多指急速或突然一次猛击。
beat: 普通用词，含义广泛，指连续打击。游戏、竞赛或战争中作打败解。
hit: 普通用词，常与strike换用，侧重有目标的猛击，强调用力击中。
thrash: 侧重指用棍子或鞭子等痛打。
whip: 多指用鞭子抽打。



knock, beat, strike, hit

knock: 敲门；
beat: 打鼓;连续打；
strike: 敲锣，钟敲几点，猛的一击；
hit: 击中，打一下



defeat, beat, overcome, conquer, subdue, overthrow

这组词都有“征服，战胜”的意思，其区别是：
defeat: 普通用词，多指在战争、比赛、竞选或辩论中战胜对手，侧重胜利的暂时性。
beat: 口笔语均可用，可与defeat换用。
overcome: 多指战胜或克服非物质的东西，如困难和不良习惯等。语气较弱也可指在斗争或竞争中战胜或压倒对方。
conquer: 侧重战胜和控制。书面用词。
subdue: 正式用词，与conquer同义，但强调失败后的臣服状态；也可用作借喻，表克制、压抑感情、欲望等。
overthrow: 指彻底击败对手，使其丧失力量和地位。



beat, win

beat: 后接sb. beat them
win: 后接sth.,反义词为lose, win the game,


vt. 打；打败
 - strike, tank, best
vi. 打；打败；拍打；有节奏地舒张与收缩
 - strike, hit
n. 拍子；敲击；有规律的一连串敲打
 - tempo
adj. 筋疲力尽的；疲惫不堪的
 - knackered, outspent
examples: 英 [biːt] 美 [biːt]
v.打；打败；跳动；敲打；战胜n.拍子；敲打；心跳声adj.精疲力尽的

(1) His father beat the disobedient boy.(2) He's alive；his heart is still beating.(3) They beat drums to cheer up the players.(4) Had it not been for the PLA, we wouldn't have been able to beat the flood.(5) Every member of the band must follow the beat.(6) We heard the beat of a drum.(7) When you're close to me, I can feel your heart beat.(8) I am completely beat.
(1) 他的父亲打那个不听话的男孩。(2) 他还活著－－心脏还在跳。(3) 他们擂鼓给运动员加油。(4) 要不是人民解放军,我们是无法战胜洪水的。(5) 乐队的每个成员都必须跟着拍子演奏。(6) 我们听见敲鼓的声音。(7) 当你走近我的身旁,我能感觉你的心跳。(8) 我累极了。

translation:
adj. 美丽的，美好的; 极好的

分布：美丽的(85%)，好的(11%)，出色的(4%)


a.美的,美丽的;出色的,完美的In the beautiful bureau my daughter's laughter served for the sauce of the sausage.在漂亮的办公署,女儿的笑声充当了香肠的调料.



US [-tˌɪ-] adjective  ESSENTIAL  ■very attractive 美丽的，漂亮的
•a beautiful woman美女

•breathtakingly beautiful scenery美得惊人的景色

•She was wearing a beautiful dress.她穿着一条漂亮的连身裙。
 ESSENTIAL  ■very pleasant 美好的；极好的
•a beautiful piece of music一首优美的歌曲

•beautiful weather极好的天气
■mainly US ■very kind 仁慈的
•You did a beautiful thing in helping those poor children.你帮助那些可怜的孩子，真是爱心之举呀。

UK ['bju:.tɪ.fəl] US [-tˌɪ-] adjective the beautiful game UK ■football 足球
UK ['bju:.tɪ.fəl] US [-tˌɪ-] adjective the beautiful people ■fashionable, rich people 时尚而富有的人；上层社会时髦人物
•This café is a favourite haunt of the beautiful people.这间咖啡厅是上层社会时髦人物最爱光顾的地方之一。

UK ['bju:.tɪ.fəl] US [-tˌɪ-] adjective   Common Learner Errors   beautifulWarning: Check your spelling!Beautiful is one of the 50 words most often spelled wrongly by learners.Remember: the correct spelling has 'eau' and only one 'l'.
UK ['bju:.tɪ.fəl] US [-tˌɪ-] adjective   Common Learner Errors   beautifulWarning:  Common word-building error!Adjectives which end in the suffix -ful have only one 'l'.Don't write 'beautifull', write beautiful.




beautiful, lovely, handsome, fine, pretty, fair

这组词都有“美丽的，漂亮的”的意思，其区别是：
beautiful: 普通用词，含义广泛，语气最强，指优美和谐，是一种几乎接近完美的美。指人时通常形容女人或小孩，很少用于描写男子。
lovely: 普通用词，描写人时，主要指女人和小孩的相貌，语气不如beautiful强。
handsome: 多用于描写男性的英俊潇洒。有时也形容女人，指其五官端正，体态秀丽。
fine: 指在容貌、身材或风度等方面令人感到可爱。用于事物时，强调形式或内容的优美。
pretty: 普通用词，语气比beautiful弱，多用于描写妇女、儿童以及小巧玲珑，精美可爱之物。
fair: 正式用词，多用于文学中，形容女子和儿童，侧重外表的美。



beautiful, handsome, pretty, good-looking

beautiful: 貌美动人，气质高雅；
handsome: 体态健美端庄；
pretty: 活泼可爱；
good-looking: 一般性“好看”


adj. 美丽的
 - fair, seraphic
examples: 英 ['bjuːtɪfl] 美 ['bjuːtɪfl]
adj.美丽的；好的；出色的

(1) She is, as it were, the most beautiful girl I've ever seen.(2) Looking at a beautiful painting always gives one satisfaction.(3) The weather has been beautiful this week.(4) The next section will be devoted to the beautiful result.(5) He produced his beautiful treatment of irrational numbers.(6) You need to get into your artwork to make it look beautiful.
(1) 她可说是我见过的最漂亮的姑娘。(2) 观赏一幅美丽的图画使人心满意足。(3) 这星期天气一直很好。(4) 在下一节中，我们将给出一个非常好的结果。(5) 他对无理数作了出色的处理。(6) 你需要认真投入你的艺术作品好让它看来出色。
[sound:youdao-48cd9d6c-3bdccf03-9f40feea-5b03b756-2fb33407.mp3]

translation:
n. 美好; 美人; 完美; 突出的范例

分布：美丽(79%)，美人(16%)，美的东西(5%)


→词源同beau, 美丽的，漂亮的。-ty, 抽象名词后缀。
n.美,美丽;美人,美丽的事物Her beauty is magical.她美丽无比.



US [-tˌi] noun  ESSENTIAL  countable or uncountable ■the quality of being pleasing, especially to look at, or someone or something that gives great pleasure, especially by being looked at 美，美丽；美人；美景
•This is an area of outstanding natural beauty.这个地方的风景优美，浑然天成。

•The piece of music he played had a haunting beauty.他演奏的这首乐曲优美动听，教人久久不能忘怀。

•beauty products/treatments美容产品／美容（化妆）

•She was a great beauty (= a beautiful woman) when she was young.她年轻时是个大美人。

•The beauty of this plan (= what makes it good) is that it won't cost too much.这计划的好处在于花费不多。
countable informal ■something that is an excellent example of its type 美好的事物
•She showed me her car - it's a beauty.她给我看了她的汽车——可真是漂亮。

•Your roses are beauties this year.你的玫瑰今年开得真漂亮。

UK ['bju:.ti] US [-tˌi] noun  Beauty is in the eye of the beholder. saying ■This means that not all people have the same opinions about what is attractive. 情人眼里出西施。
UK ['bju:.ti] US [-tˌi] noun  Beauty is only skin deep. saying ■said to emphasize that a person's character is more important than how they look 美貌不过一层皮（指人品比外表更重要）。
UK ['bju:.ti] US [-tˌi] noun  your beauty sleep humorous ■the sleep that you need in order to feel and look healthy and attractive 美容觉



n. 美；美丽；美人；美好的东西
 - fair, pulchritude
examples: 英 ['bjuːti] 美 ['bjuːti]
n.美人；美丽；美的东西

(1) Beauty's tears are lovelier than her smile.(2) His wife is an unmatched beauty.(3) Words cannot describe the beauty of the scene.(4) The beauty of the scene filled us with enchantment.(5) This bird cannot be paralled for beauty.(6) The beauty of living in California is that the weather is so good.(7) You have no feeling for the beauty of nature.
(1) 美人的泪水比微笑更可爱。(2) 他妻子是一个倾国倾城的美人。(3) 语言难以描述那景色之美丽。(4) 我们被美丽的景色迷住了。(5) 这鸟的美丽是无与伦比的。(6) 在加利福尼亚居住的好处就在于气候宜人。(7) 你对大自然的美缺乏欣赏力。

translation:
conj. 因为

分布：因为(84%)，由于(16%)


→前缀be-, 强调。cause, 原因。
conj.因为,由于The applause paused because of the cause caused by a cautious plausible clause.掌声停了是因为一条谨慎的似乎有理的条款引起的原因.



US [-'kɑ:z] conjunction  ESSENTIAL  ■for the reason that 因为，由于
•"Why did you do it?" "Because Carlos told me to".“你为甚么做出这事？”“因为卡洛斯叫我去做的。”

•We can't go to Julia's party because we're going away that weekend.我们不能参加朱莉娅的聚会，因为那个周末我们要外出。

•Just because I'm lending you my dress for tonight doesn't mean you can borrow it whenever you want to.我今晚把裙子借给你，但并不意味着你任何时候想借就可以借的。

•informal Have you been away, because (= the reason I am asking is that) we haven't seen you recently?最近我们没有见过你，你是不是外出了？

UK [bɪ'kəz/ UK [-'kɒz] US [-'kɑ:z] conjunction   Common Learner Errors   becauseWarning:  Check your spelling!Because  is one of the 50 words most often spelled wrongly by learners.Remember: don't write 'ou', write au.
UK [bɪ'kəz/ UK [-'kɒz] US [-'kɑ:z] conjunction   Common Learner Errors   because or because of?Because  is a conjunction and is used before a clause. It is never followed by 'of':✗ I was late because of there was heavy traffic.I was late because there was heavy traffic.Because of is a preposition and is always used before a noun or noun phrase:✗ I was late because heavy traffic.I was late because of heavy traffic.




as, because, for, since

这些连词均含有“因为”之意。
as: 从属连词，语意较because,  since弱，着重在主句，所表示的原因或理由是“附带的”。
because: 从属连词，语意强，着重直接的原因或理由，所引出的从句是全句的重心，用以回答why提出的问题。
for: 并列连词，语气较弱，所引出的句子一般放在后面，表示附带说明的理由或推断理由。
since: 语意比because弱，但比as强，一般用于表示“由于大家已知的事实”。



because, because of

because: 连词，连接两句话，
because of: 介词短语，后接词或短语 He didn't go to school because of his illness.


conj. 因为
 - since, for, seeing, that
examples: 英 [bɪ'kɒz] 美 [bɪ'kɔːz]
conj.因为；由于

(1) I bought the house simply because it was large.(2) An argument was inevitable because they disliked each other so much.(3) I knew she was joking because she had a big grin on her face.(4) Many beautiful fish are fast disappearing because of the severe pollution.(5) The player defaulted in the tournament because of her injury.
(1) 我购买了这房子，只是因为它面积大。(2) 争论是不可避免的，因为他们彼此非常厌恶。(3) 我知道她是在开玩笑，因为她脸上堆满笑容。(4) 因为污染严重，许多美丽的鱼类正在面临绝种。(5) 在这次循环赛中,这位运动员由于受伤而弃权。
[sound:youdao-d29709d9-f2c245a0-98ae3a3d-176d5b5b-19cc2e0f.mp3]

translation:
vi. 变为，成为; 变得; 变成
vt. 适合，适宜; 相称，相当; 变成; 发生

时态：became, become, becoming, becomes
分布：成为(58%)，变得(25%)，变成(17%)


→前缀be-, 强调。come, 来到。
vi.变成,开始变得vt.适合,同...相称With shortcomings overcome, the outcome become welcome.随着缺点被克服,结果变得受欢迎.



[bɪ'kʌm] (became, become)verb BE  成为   ESSENTIAL  [L] ■to start to be 变成，成为，变得
•I was becoming increasingly suspicious of his motives.我越来越怀疑他的动机。

•It was becoming cold, so we lit the fire.天气越来越冷了，所以我们燃起了火。

•After giving up smoking, he became fat and irritable.戒烟后，他发福了，而且很爱发火。

•Margaret Thatcher became Britain's first woman prime minister in 1979.玛格丽特‧戴卓尔在1979年成为英国第一位女首相。

•He has just become a father.他刚刚当上爸爸。

[bɪ'kʌm] (became, become)verb SUIT  适合     transitive old-fashioned ■to cause to look attractive or to be suitable for 使好看；适合，适于
•That colour really becomes you.那种颜色很适合你。

[bɪ'kʌm] (became, become)verb   Phrasal Verbs   [not continuous] become of sb/sth ■If you ask what became of someone or something, you want to know where they are and what happened to them （人或事物的）情况（如何），结果（怎样）
•Whatever became of that parcel you sent?你寄出的包裹怎么样了？

•And Mickey Adams - I wonder what became of him.还有米基‧亚当斯——不知他当时怎么样？





turn, get, grow, become, come, go

这组词都有“变成，成为”的意思，其区别是：
turn: 侧重指变得与原来截然不同，有时含贬义。
get: 常指某人或某物有意无意地获得引起变化的因素，结果使变成另一状态。
grow: 常指逐渐地变成新状态，强调渐变的过程。
become: 最普通用词，作为连系动词，指从一个状态向另一个状态的变化。
come: 侧重变化的经过或过程，多用于不良情况。
go: 作为连系动词，通常与形容词连用，指进入某种状态，从而发生变化，多指不好的状态。


vi. 成为；变得；变成
 - get, fall, come
vt. 适合；相称
 - suit, adapt to something
examples: 英 [bɪ'kʌm] 美 [bɪ'kʌm]
v.变成；成为；变得；适合（某人）；使（人）显得漂亮

(1) Vast areas of land have become desert.(2) You may also find that reading has become more fun than work!(3) The entrepreneur has become a news figure.(4) Every one cannot become businessman.(5) This place has become a famous summer resort.(6) This priest wants to become a bishop.(7) The meeting began to become clamorous.(8) I was pleased to see how peaceable the horse had become.(9) The weather became warmer.(10) Class distinctions have become less important during the last 50 years.(11) Such behavior did not become her.

(1) 广大的地区均已变成沙漠。(2) 你或许也会发现阅读已经变成是有趣的事，而不是工作。(3) 这位企业家变成了新闻人物。(4) 不是所有的人都能成为商人。(5) 这个地方已成为一个避暑胜地。(6) 这位牧师想成为主教。(7) 会议开始变得喧哗了。(8) 我很高兴地看到这匹马变得这么温顺。(9) 天气变暖和了。(10) 在过去五十年间，社会等级差别已经变得不那么重要了。(11) 这种举止与她的身份不相称。
英 [bed] 美 [bed]
n.床；基座；底层；河床；花坛；苗圃；地层v.安置；发生性关系

(1) Life isn't a bed of roses.(2) Can you give me a bed for the night?(3) The machine rests on a bed of concrete.(4) The water is infiltrating the gravel bed.(5) The brook warbled over its rocky bed.(6) There sits a flower bed in the middle of the garden.(7) The gardener raked over the bed and removed the weeds .(8) Can Mary bed down with her sister?(9) The inn keeper could bed all the new arrivals.(10) He has bedded more girls than he can remember.
(1) 人生并非事事称心如意。(2) 你能给我安置一个床铺过夜吗？(3) 机器安装在混凝土基座上。(4) 水正渗透进碎石底层。(5) 小溪潺潺流过多石的河床。(6) 园子中央有一座花坛。(7) 园林工人翻耙苗圃，除掉杂草。(8) 玛丽可不可以跟她姐妹同睡一床？(9) 旅店老板能为所有新来的旅客提供住宿。(10) 他睡过的姑娘多得连自己也记不清了。
[sound:youdao-22a8897e-b4ffe7f9-3af1b520-da32ef96-1898d73b.mp3]

translation:
n. 蜜蜂; （集工作、竞赛、娱乐为一体的）聚会

分布：蜜蜂(99%)，集会(1%)


→可能来自拟声词，模仿蜜蜂嗡嗡叫的声音。
n.蜂,蜜蜂;忙碌的人A bee stung him.他被蜜蜂螫了.



noun countable INSECT  昆虫   ADVANCED  ■a yellow and black flying insect which makes honey and can sting you 蜜蜂
•A swarm of bees flew into the garden.一群蜜蜂飞进花园。

•My arm swelled up where I was stung by a bee.我手臂上被蜜蜂螫的地方肿了起来。
⇒ See also bumblebee
[bi:] noun countable GROUP  小组  US  a group of people who come together in order to take part in a particular activity （为从事某一活动而聚在一起的）一小组人
•a sewing bee缝纫会

•a spelling bee拼写比赛

[bi:] noun countable be (as) busy as a bee ■to be moving about quickly doing many things 忙得团团转
[bi:] noun countable be the bee's knees UK informal ■to be excellent or of an extremely high standard 非常出色，顶尖
•Have you tried this ice-cream? It's the bee's knees, it really is.你吃过这种雪糕吗？这是最好的，真的。

[bi:] noun countable have a bee in your bonnet ■to keep talking about something again and again because you think it is very important 念念不忘；想得入神
•She never stops talking about dieting - she's got a real bee in her bonnet about it.她不停地谈论节食——她已完全着魔了。




n. [蜂] 蜜蜂，蜂；勤劳的人
 - honeybee
examples: 英 [biː] 美 [biː]
n.蜜蜂n.集会
(1) A bee pricks the skin with its sting.(2) He can hear the hum of the bee in the garden.
(1) 蜜蜂用螫针刺皮肤。(2) 他听得见花园里蜜蜂的嗡嗡声。
[sound:youdao-360ceba8-797d4ffd-4e5334cc-30aed36f-77037637.mp3]

translation:
n. 牛肉; 菜牛（饲养以供肉食的牛）; 体力; 怨言，牢骚
vi. 抱怨，大发牢骚

时态：beefed, beefing, beefs
分布：牛肉(82%)，加强(9%)，抱怨(3%)，牢骚(2%)，肌肉(2%)，告发(1%)，力气(1%)


→词源同bovine, 牛的。
n.牛肉The bee paid the fee of coffee, beef and beer for the cheerful deer.蜜蜂为欢快的鹿付了咖啡,牛肉和啤酒的费用.



noun MEAT  肉   ADVANCED  uncountable ■the flesh of cattle (= cows) which is eaten 牛肉
•The spaghetti sauce is made with UK minced / US ground beef.这种意粉的调味汁是用牛肉碎做成的。

•People in England often have roast beef and Yorkshire pudding for lunch on Sundays.英国人在星期天的午餐，通常是吃烤牛肉和约克郡布丁。

•He is a beef cattle farmer.他专门饲养菜牛。

[bi:f] noun FORCE  力气  uncountable mainly UK informal ■strength, power or force 力量，力气
•He said that the newly published government report didn't have much beef in it.他称新发布的政府报告没甚么力度。

•Push harder! Put some beef into it!再用点力推！加把劲！

[bi:f] noun COMPLAINT  抱怨  countable informal ■a complaint 抱怨
•My main beef about the job is that I have to work on Saturdays.我对这份工作最大的不满是周六还要上班。

[bi:f] verb intransitive informal ■to complain 抱怨
•He was beefing about having to do the shopping.他在为不得不去购物而抱怨。

[bi:f] verb intransitive informal   Phrasal Verbs   [M] beef sth up ■to make something stronger or more important 加强，充实
•We need to find some new players to beef up the team.我们要招纳几个新队员，加强全队的实力。

•The company has plans to beef up its production.公司计划扩大生产。

•Your report on the new car park is fine, but why don't you beef it up a bit with some figures?你那份关于新停车场的报告很不错，但怎么不加一些数据，让报告更充实呢？




n. [食品] 牛肉；肌肉；食用牛；牢骚
 - muscle, hotpot
vi. 抱怨，告发；发牢骚
 - repine, rail against
vt. 养；加强
 - enhance, cement, muscle
examples: 英 [biːf] 美 [biːf]
n.牛肉；肌肉；力气；牢骚v.抱怨；告发；加强

(1) Do you like stewed beef?(2) Africa is exporting beef to Europe.(3) He's got plenty of beef.(4) My beef is that it took too much time.(5) He is forever beefing about that.(6) I 've never quite understood why people beef about the price of dinner.(7) We need new young players to beef up the team.
(1) 你喜欢吃炖牛肉吗？(2) 非洲向欧洲出口牛肉。(3) 他肌肉发达。(4) 我的抱怨是太花时间了。(5) 他没完没了地为那事抱怨。(6) 我一直不太明白人们为什么要抱怨餐费。(7) 我们需要新的队员来加强球队的实力。
[sound:youdao-f67ca55a-85fc496b-49551d1b-ef380cef-cbef7615.mp3]

translation:
prep. 在…之前; 先于，优于; 当着…的面; 与其…
conj. 在…之前; 在…以前; 比…早些; 与其…
adv. 先前，从前; 在前，在前方

分布：之前(70%)，以前(24%)，以往(3%)，在 ... 以前(2%)，在..前面(1%)


→前缀be-, 强调。fore, 前面的。
在前面(be+fore前面)[be-①构成动词"使…成为"②构成一些介词]
prep.(指时间)在...以前,在..前面,在..之前They've seen that long before.他们早就看过那个了.



US [-'fɔ:r] preposition adverb conjunction  ESSENTIAL  ■at or during a time earlier than (the thing mentioned) 在…之前；以前
•You should always wash your hands before meals.饭前应该洗手。

•Before leaving he said goodbye to each of them.他离开前向每个人告别。

•She's always up before dawn.她总是在天亮前就起床了。

•Before he could reach the door, she quickly closed it.他还没走到门前，她就迅速关上了门。

•Before we make a decision, does anyone want to say anything else?趁我们还未作决定，还有人想说甚么吗？

•She had to give the doorman a tip before (= in order that) he would help her with her suitcases.她要给看门房小费，让他帮忙提箱子。
 ESSENTIAL  ■until (the event mentioned) 直到…为止（到某事之前）
•It was an hour before the police arrived.员警一小时后才赶到。
 ESSENTIAL  * in the past 
•He said he had never seen her before.他说他以前从未见过她。

•I feel as though I've been here before.我觉得以前好像曾到过这里。

UK [bɪ'fɔ:r] US [-'fɔ:r] preposition  ESSENTIAL  ■in front of 在…前面
•The letter K comes before L in the English alphabet.在英文字母表中，K排在L前面。

•Many mothers put their children's needs before their own.很多母亲都把孩子的需要置于自己的需要之前。

•We have the whole weekend before us - what shall we do?我们有整个周末的时间——做些甚么呢？

•He stood up before a whole roomful of people, and asked her to marry him.他在满屋子人面前站起来向她求婚。
 ESSENTIAL  ■If a place is before another place, you will arrive at it first when you are travelling towards the second place （场所）在…之前
•The bus stop is just before the school.公车站就在学校的前面。
 ADVANCED  ■To be before someone or a group of people, is to be formally considered or examined by that person or group 由…考虑（或审查）
•The proposal before the committee is that we try and reduce our spending by 10%.委员会正在考虑我们打算降低10%开支的建议。

•The men appeared before the judge yesterday.这些人昨天出庭了。





before, ago

这组词都有“……以前”的意思，其区别是：
before: 或指从过去某一时间起向前推算的若干时间的以前，通常与过去完成时连用；或泛指以前，并不具体指若干时间以前，可使用现在完成的或过去时；还可指从将来某一时间起的若干时间以前。
ago: 指从现在起往前推算一段时间，始终置于所修饰的词之后，与一般过去时连用。



in front of, in the front of, before

这组词都有“在……前”的意思，其区别是：
in front of: 指在某地方之外的前面，即不在其中，多与静态动词连用，通常可与before通用。
in the front of: 指在某地方之内的前面，即在其中的前部分。
before: 指空间位置或时间的“在……前”。表时间时，反义词为after；指空间位置时，其反义词是behind。


prep. 在…之前，先于
 - avant
adv. 以前；在前
 - previously, ago, formerly, prior, back
conj. 在…以前；在…之前
 - until
examples: 英 [bɪ'fɔː(r)] 美 [bɪ'fɔːr]
conj.在 ... 以前pref.在 ... 以前；在..前面adv.以前；以往；之前

(1) B comes before C in the alphabet.(2) He made a statement before the House of Commons.(3) He always put the interests of others before his own.(4) I'd met him once before.(5) I have seen that film before.(6) I was inspired to work harder than ever before.(7) He used to get some shut-eye before the game.(8) He overlooked the contract before he signed it.(9) I'll try to rush the book through before Saturday.
(1) B在字母表里排在C之前。(2) 他在下议院当众发表了一个声明。(3) 他总把他人的利益放在第一位。(4) 我曾经见过他。(5) 那部电影我以前看过。(6) 我受激励比以往任何时候都更加努力地工作。(7) 他以往常常在比赛前睡一会儿。(8) 他在签字之前仔细阅读了合同。(9) 我会设法在星期六之前把这本书赶紧看完。
[sound:youdao-02ade241-cac5e81e-ffa8a058-af3ada3c-7f0bfd27.mp3]

translation:
vt. & vi. 乞讨; 恳求（原谅）; 回避（问题）

时态：begged, begging, begs
分布：乞讨(60%)，恳求(40%)


→词源不确定，俗词源认为来自于bag, 背包流浪乞讨的。
vt.请求,乞求vi.恳请,行乞Spell smell! Very well, the well-being for human being will swell.拼写气味(一词)!很好,人类的福利将会膨胀.



[beg] (-gg-)verb  ADVANCED  intransitive or transitive ■to make a very strong and urgent request 乞求
•They begged for mercy.他们乞求饶恕。

•[+ speech] "Please, please forgive me!" she begged (him).“请原谅我！”她请求（他）说。

•[+ obj + to infinitive] He begged her to stay, but she simply laughed and put her bags in the car.他求她留下来，但是她只是一笑置之，然后把袋子放进汽车里。
 ADVANCED  intransitive or transitive ■to ask for food or money because you are poor 乞讨，行乞
•There are more and more homeless people begging on the streets these days.近来越来越多无家可归的人在街上行乞。

•She had to beg for money and food for her children.她不得不为孩子们乞讨金钱和食物。
intransitive ■If a dog begs, it sits with its front legs in the air as if to ask for something （狗）作乞求状
•They have trained their dog to sit up and beg.他们训练狗两腿直立做乞求动作。
I beg your pardon ■a polite way of saying "I am sorry" or "Could you repeat what you just said?" （礼貌的说法）对不起，你能否再说一遍■a way of showing that you are angry about something that someone has just said. 指对之前某人所说的话很生气
•I beg your pardon? I hope you're not implying that I lied!我没听错吧？我希望你不是在暗示我撒谎了！

[beg] (-gg-)verb beg the question ■If a statement or situation begs the question, it causes you to ask a particular question （说法或情况）使人想要提出问题
•Spending the summer travelling round India is a great idea, but it does rather beg the question of how we can afford it.到印度去旅行过夏天当然是个好主意，但关键问题是我们如何能负担得起。

•To discuss the company's future begs the question whether it has a future.要讨论这间公司的前途问题，不得不问一句：这间公司有前途吗？

[beg] (-gg-)verb  beg , borrow or steal ■to do whatever is necessary to get something （为获得某物）不择手段
•I'm going to get a dress for the ball, whether I have to beg, borrow or steal one.我要找一套舞会上穿的晚装，不管是去讨、借还是偷。

[beg] (-gg-)verb go begging UK informal ■If something is going begging, it is available to be taken because no one else wants it 无人问津，没人要
•If that bottle of wine is going begging, I'll have it.如果那瓶酒没人要，那我就买下。

[beg] (-gg-)verb I beg to differ/disagree ■a polite way of saying "I do not agree" （礼貌的说法）恐怕我难以苟同
[beg] (-gg-)verb   Phrasal Verbs   beg off ■to ask to be allowed not to do something that you are expected to do 请求不做…
•She begged off early from the party because she was so tired.她请求早点离开聚会，因为她太累了。





beg, implore, request, pray, require, claim, entreat, ask, demand

这组词都有“要求，请求”的意思，其区别是：
beg: 指恳切地或再三地请求或要求，常含低三下四意味，也多用于应酬场合。
implore: 书面用词，着重指迫切、焦急或痛苦地恳求或哀求，常含较强的感情色彩。
request: 正式用词，指非常正式，有礼貌的请求或恳求，多含担心因种种原因对方不能答应的意味。
pray: 语气庄重，指热情、诚恳和敬祈的要求，现不很常用。
require: 强调根据事业、需要或纪律、法律等而提出的要求。
claim: 指有权或宣称有权得到而公开提出的要求。
entreat: 泛指一般“恳求或哀求”，含企图说服对方或用热烈的请求软化反对意见的意味。
ask: 最普通用词，指向对方提出要求或请求，长、晚辈，上下级之间都可使用。
demand: 一般指理直气壮地提出强烈要求，或坚持不让对方拒绝的要求。



beg, plead, petition, appeal, pray, entreat

这组词都有“请求，恳求”的意思，其区别是：
beg: 比plead通俗，不用于法律范畴，指低声下气地请求，有时含贬义，指某人喋喋不休地要求得到帮助。
plead: 指谦卑而又不失尊严地请求，侧重迫切感。
petition: 指正式而热切地请愿或祈求。
appeal: 常指以道义原则为基础或以法律为依据的请求。
pray: 指祈求，多用于宗教用语中。
entreat: 意义与beg的大致相同，但较文雅。


vt. 乞讨；恳求；回避正题
 - pray for, beseech
vi. 乞讨；请求
 - demand, apply for
examples: 英 [beɡ] 美 [beɡ]
v.恳求；乞讨abbr.开始(=begin)

(1) She begs them not to punish her son severely.(2) The boys hailed passing cars to beg a ride.(3) He knew he had hurt her and begged her to forgive him.(4) He lives by begging.(5) He was too lazy to work and too proud to beg.
(1) 她恳求他们不要给他儿子太重的处罚。(2) 这些男孩向过往的汽车呼叫恳求乘车。(3) 他自知伤了她的心而央求她原谅。(4) 他以行乞为生。(5) 他懒于工作,又不屑乞讨。
[sound:youdao-febcdb58-4d524a5a-92e21fb7-d64dc25e-cdfe6cdc.mp3]

translation:
n. 乞丐; 家伙
vt. 使贫困; 使无用

时态：beggared, beggaring, beggars
分布：乞丐(91%)，穷人(4%)，使贫穷(3%)，使不能(1%)，使不足(1%)


乞丐(beg乞求)[-ar 1.表形容词"…的"2.表名词"人,物"]



US [-ɚ] noun countable ■a poor person who lives by asking others for money or food 乞丐，叫花子■UK informal ■a person, especially when you are expressing an opinion about something that they have done, or that has happened to them 家伙
•You've won again, you lucky beggar.你又赢了，你这个幸运的家伙！

•Those children have been running about in my rose garden again, the little beggars (= annoying people) !那些孩子又在我的玫瑰园里到处乱跑，真是些淘气的小家伙！

UK ['beg.ər] US [-ɚ] noun countable Beggars can't be choosers. saying ■said when you recognize that you must accept an offer or a situation because it is the only one available to you 要饭的哪能挑肥拣瘦；别无选择
•I would have preferred a house of my own rather than sharing, but beggars can't be choosers, I suppose.我较喜欢独住一屋而不是跟别人住在一起，可是我想我不该挑三拣四的，是吧。

UK ['beg.ər] US [-ɚ] verb transitive literary■to make a person or organisation, etc. extremely poor 使（人或组织等）极度贫穷
UK ['beg.ər] US [-ɚ] verb transitive beggar belief/description ■to be impossible to believe or describe 非言语所能形容，难以置信
•His cruelty beggared belief/description.他凶残至极，简直令人难以置信／形容。




n. 乞丐；穷人；家伙
 - apple, customer, egg, fellow, guy
vt. 使贫穷；使沦为乞丐
 - impoverish, pauperize
examples: 英 ['beɡə(r)] 美 ['beɡər]
n.乞丐；穷人；【英】家伙vt.使贫穷；使不足；使不能

(1) The beggar shivered in his scanty clothes.(2) The beggar spun a long yarn about his misfortunes.(3) The beggar dressed in rags.(4) The beggar fell down in a swoon from sheer hunger.(5) He's a cheerful little beggar, your son!(6) They were beggared by trying to pay for their son's education.(7) The canyon was so beautiful as to beggar description.(8) Her beauty beggars description.
(1) 乞丐穿着单薄，冻得发抖。(2) 那个乞丐编造了一大篇自己如何遭遇不幸的故事。(3) 这个穷人衣衫褴褛。(4) 那个穷人饿得晕倒了。(5) 你的儿子可是个活泼愉快的小家伙！(6) 为付儿子的教育费用，他们变穷了。(7) 峡谷美丽无比，非言语所能形容。(8) 她的美貌难以形容。
[sound:youdao-86c083b4-cd9eeedd-ac6b0320-1c55e15a-f79b1f9f.mp3]

translation:
vt. & vi. 开始; 着手; 创始; 创办
vi. （从…）开始; 起始; 起初是; 开始讲话

时态：began, begun, beginning, begins
分布：开始(95%)，着手(5%)


→前缀be-, 强调。-gin, 打开。
v.(began,begun)开始,着手At the dawn on the lawn the yawning drowned man began to frown.拂晓时在草坪上,打呵欠的溺水者开始皱眉头.



[bɪ'gɪn] (beginning, began, begun)verb intransitive or transitive  ESSENTIAL  ■to start to be, do, etc. 开始；开始进行（或存在）；着手（于）
•I began the book six months ago, but I can't seem to finish it.我六个月前就开始看这本书，但似乎总是看不完。

•I have so much to tell you, I don't know where to begin.我有很多话要跟你说，不知从何谈起。

•What time does the concert begin?音乐会甚么时候开始？

•The bridge was begun five years ago and the estimated cost has already doubled.这座桥五年前开始建造，到现在为止估计成本已经增加了一倍。

•The film they want to watch begins at seven.他们要看的电影在七点开场。

•If you want to learn to play a musical instrument, it might be a good idea to begin on something simple.如果你想学一种乐器，从简单的开始或许是个好主意。

•The word 'cat' begins with the letter 'c'.单词 cat 以字母 c 开头。

•The meeting began promisingly , but then things started to go wrong.会议开始时很不错，不过后来出了问题。

•[+ -ing verb] Jane has just begun learning to drive.珍妮刚开始学驾驶。

•[+ to infinitive] After waiting for half an hour she was beginning to get angry.等了半小时后，她开始生气了。

•[+ speech] "Well, " he began (= started by saying). "I don't quite know how to tell you this."“唉，”他开始说，“我真是不知道该怎么样跟你说这件事。”
to begin with ■at the start of a process, event or situation 原先，刚开始
•There were six of us to begin with, then two people left.原先，我们有6个人，后来走了两个。
■used to give the first important reason for something 首先，第一
•The hotel was awful! To begin with, our room was far too small.这间饭店太差了！首先是我们的房间太小。

[bɪ'gɪn] (beginning, began, begun)verb intransitive or transitive can't (even) begin ■If you can't (even) begin to do something, it is very difficult for you to do it 难以着手
•As a wealthy businessman, he couldn't even begin to imagine real poverty.作为一个富商，他难以想像真正的贫穷是甚么样子。

[bɪ'gɪn] (beginning, began, begun)verb intransitive or transitive   Common Learner Errors   beginWarning: Check your verb endings!Many learners make mistakes when using begin  in the past tense.The past simple of begin is began :✗ He closed his eyes and begun to sing.He closed his eyes and began to sing.Begun is the past participle of begin :The town has begun to flourish.




inaugurate, commence, start, initiate, begin

这组词都有“开始”的意思，其区别是：
inaugurate: 指正式而隆重的开始。
commence: 可与begin换用，但commence系书面正式用词，语气庄重，特指有正式程序或一定仪式，或某种正式行动的“开始”。
start: 在许多场合可与begin通用，但start侧重动作的起点。
initiate: 指创始或发起，侧重某过程的第一步，不考虑结束，强调起始。
begin: 最常用词，含义广泛，其反义词是end，多用于行动、工作等的开始。


vt. 开始
 - institute, initiate, start in, lead off, to box
vi. 开始；首先
 - proceed, start in
examples: 英 [bɪ'ɡɪn] 美 [bɪ'ɡɪn]
v.开始；着手
(1) The meeting will begin at nine.(2) I have to begin with an apology.(3) When did you begin learning English?(4) The leaves begin to fall when autumn comes.
(1) 会议将在九点开始。(2) 我得首先表示歉意。(3) 你何时开始学习英语的？(4) 秋天来临时, 树叶开始落下。

translation:
n. 新手，初学者; 创立人，鼻祖; 初学者的好运气（或意外成功）

分布：初学者(75%)，新手(25%)


US [-ɚ] noun countable  IMPROVER  ■a person who is starting to do something or learn something for the first time 新手，初学者
•This judo class is for beginners only.这个课程是专为初学者开设的。




n. 初学者；新手；创始人
 - author, learner, novice
examples: 英 [bɪ'ɡɪnə(r)] 美 [bɪ'ɡɪnər]
n.初学者；新手

(1) For a beginner, you are pretty good.(2) No,as a beginner,you needn't start from blocks.(3) He's a rank beginner of the job, but he'll learn.(4) I thought you were hurt by Edward's saying you were a duffer and a beginner.
(1) 对一个初学者来说，你是相当不错了。(2) 作为初学者，你就不必用起跑器起跑了。(3) 他干这工作是个新手，做得很差，但他会学好的。(4) 我认为你是被爱德华说是笨蛋和新手的话所伤害了。
[sound:youdao-953d812a-d1183cdd-ce75744b-5cc5efd4-a64e7a84.mp3]

translation:
n. 利益; 维护; 支持

分布：代表(89%)，利益(9%)，方面(2%)


→前缀be-, 强调，在。half, 半，边。在另一边的，代表另一方利益的。
n.利益"My behavior is on behalf of half zebras," the algebra teacher said."我的行为代表了一半斑马的利益,"代数老师说.



US [-'hæf] noun on behalf of sb (on sb's behalf)  ADVANCED  ■representing; instead of 代表（某人）；作为（某人）的代表；代替（某人）
•On behalf of the entire company, I would like to thank you for all your work.我代表全公司对你的工作表示感谢。

•Unfortunately, George cannot be with us today so I am pleased to accept this award on his behalf.可惜乔治今天不能出席，因此我很荣幸能替他代领这个奖。
■for the good of or because of 因为，为了…的利益
•Please don't leave on my behalf.请不要因为我而离开。




n. 代表；利益
 - representation, deputy, benefit, sake, profit
examples: 英 [bɪ'hɑːf] 美 [bɪ'hæf]
n.代表；利益；方面

(1) The agent spoke on behalf of his principal.(2) On behalf of my colleagues and myself I thank you.(3) He agreed to testify on behalf of the accused man.(4) I put up the proposal on your behalf.(5) I made all these troubles in your behalf.(6) I intervened on her behalf to try to get the decision changed.(7) Jim gave the vote of thanks on behalf of the fellowship.(8) They threatened to become distressed sellers of large volumes of debt securities where they had been the biggest investors or had held assets on behalf of others.
(1) 代理人代表他的委托人说话。(2) 我代表我的同事和我本人向你表示感谢。(3) 他同意为被告作证。(4) 我是为你的利益才提出这个建议的。(5) 我是为了你才找这么多麻烦的。(6) 我为她力争，以求改变决定。(7) 在团体的利益方面，吉姆鼓掌表示感谢。(8) 它们威胁称，有可能被迫抛售大量债券，它们要么是这些债券的最大投资者，要么代表其它方面持有这些资产。

translation:
n. 行为; 态度; （机器等的）运转状态; （事物的）反应

分布：行为(91%)，举止(6%)，态度(2%)，习性(1%)


举止行为(behave的名词)[hav=possess表示"拥有"]
n.(behaviour)行为,举止;(机器等)运转情况"My behavior is on behalf of half zebras," the algebra teacher said."我的行为代表了一半斑马的利益,"代数老师说.





conduct, behavior, manner

这组词都有“行为，举止”的意思，其区别是：
conduct: 较正式用词，泛指某人的行动。侧重根据社会道德标准和责任感。
behavior: 普通用词，侧重指某人在特定场合对他人或在他人面前的行为、举止。
manner: 主要用来指人的习惯行为。


n. 行为，举止；态度；反应
 - dealing, going, reaction, response, bearing
examples: 英 [bɪ'heɪvjə] 美 [bɪ'heɪvjə]
n.行为；举止；习性；态度

(1) His behavior was, in a word, shocking.(2) His behavior called forth sharp criticism.(3) His strange behavior made the police suspicious.(4) Their behavior towards me shows that they do not like me.(5) They observed the behavior of their new pet.
(1) 总之，他的行为是令人震惊的。(2) 他的行为招致尖锐的批评。(3) 他不寻常的举止引起了警察的怀疑。(4) 他们对我的举止说明他们不喜欢我。(5) 他们观察他们新宠物的生活习性。
[sound:youdao-cf5322fe-37c7c898-8c7f903e-f95ee055-b89c0900.mp3]

translation:
prep. （表示位置）在…的后面; 支持; （表示顺序）在身后; （表示比较）落后于
adv. 在后面; 向后; 在后面较远处; （落）在后面
n. 〈口〉屁股

分布：落后于(38%)，迟(22%)，不如(17%)，在...之后(6%)，追赶(5%)，基于(3%)，迟于...(3%)，落后地(3%)，在后面地(3%)


→前缀be-, 强调。hind, 后面，见hindsight, 后见之明。
prep.在...的背后,(遗留)在..后面;落后于It's acertained that the certificate is behind the curtain of the stainless steel container.经查实证书在不锈钢容器的帘子后面.



preposition adverb  ESSENTIAL  ■at the back (of) 在（…的）后面
•Look behind you!往后看！

•I hung my coat behind the door.我把大衣挂在门后了。

•Alex led, and I followed along behind.亚历斯带头，我紧随其后。

•mainly UK As hard as she tried, she always fell behind the other swimmers in the races.比赛时不管她怎样努力，总是落在其他游泳选手的后面。

•figurative I knew that behind (= hidden by) her smile was sadness.我知道她在用微笑掩饰着内心的忧伤。

[bɪ'haɪnd] preposition adverb be behind sb (all the way) ■to support someone (completely) in what they are doing （全力）支持（某人）
[bɪ'haɪnd] preposition adverb  Behind every great / successful man there stands a woman. saying ■said to emphasize that men's success often depends on the work and support of their wives 每个成功的男人背后都有一个女人。
[bɪ'haɪnd] preposition adverb behind the wheel ■driving a motor vehicle 开车
•I'm a different person when I'm behind the wheel.我一开车，就完全变成另一个人。

[bɪ'haɪnd] adverb PLACE  地方   ESSENTIAL  ■in the place where someone or something was before 在某人或某物以前所在的地方
•I was annoyed to discover that I'd left my bag behind.当我发现留下了袋子，感到很气愤。

•After the party a few people stayed behind to help clear up.派对结束后，一些客人留下来帮忙收拾打扫。

[bɪ'haɪnd] adverb SLOWER  迟缓   ADVANCED  ■slower or later than someone else, or than you should be 比别人迟或慢，落后（于）
•The old woman was behind with (= late paying) the rent.老妇人迟迟未交房租。

[bɪ'haɪnd] preposition ■responsible for or the cause of 是…背后的原因
•He wondered what was behind his neighbour's sudden friendliness.他不明白为何邻居的态度突然变得友善。

•Marie Curie was the woman behind enormous changes in the science of chemistry.居礼夫人使整个化学领域发生了巨变。

[bɪ'haɪnd] noun countable informal ■the part of the body on which a person sits; bottom 屁股
•He tripped and fell on his behind.他绊了一跤，一屁股摔在地上。

•Why don't you get off your behind (= stand up) and do something!你为何不起来做些事情！





hind, backward, behind, back

这组词都有“在后，向后”的意思，其区别是：
hind: 指成对并且分前后的东西的“后面的”。
backward: 可用于人或物，指向后的，落后的或迟钝的。
behind: 指一物同它物相对的位置或场所。
back: 作为副词或形容词时，强调所修饰物的位置以及动作运动方向。



after, behind, at the back of

这些词均有“在……后面”之意。
after: 和behind用来表地点时，前者强调的是顺序的先后，而后者侧重方向和位置的前后关系。请比较：The student sat after me.那个学生坐在我后面。(我坐在他前面)。The student sat behind me.那学生坐在我背后。after与behind用于指时间时，前者强调时间的先后顺序，而后者则着重于表示“落后……”或“迟于……”的概念。试比较：Who ruled after James I?詹姆斯一世之后是谁统治的?You are forty minutes behind schedule.你比规定的时间迟了40分钟。after多用于表示因时间上的先后而造成顺序的前后场合，behind则常用于仅指位置上的前后关系。请比较：Please shut the door after you.请随手关门。Please shut the door behind you.请关上你身后的门。
at the back of: 这个前置词短语既可指具体的位置的先后，又可用于指抽象的概念。


prep. 落后于；支持；晚于
 - with, past
n. 屁股
 - ass, rear, pratt
examples: 英 [bɪ'haɪnd] 美 [bɪ'haɪnd]
prep.在...之后；迟于...；落后于；基于；追赶adv.在后面地；落后地；迟；不如n. 屁股

(1) Who is the girl standing behind Richard?(2) The train was 10 minutes behind time.(3) Britain is behind Japan in developing modern technologies.(4) Behind your every action is self-interest.(5) The police were hard behind the escapees.(6) The lights of the city were left behind us soon as we drove along the street.(7) You'll lag behind if you don't study harder.(8) He didn't want to fall behind in his lessons.(9) I fell behind in my payments.(10) She was never behind in offering advice.(11) Little Tom gave him a kick in the behind.

(1) 站在理查德后面的那个姑娘是谁？(2) 火车晚到了十分钟。(3) 在发展现代技术方面英国落后于日本。(4) 你的每一行动都出于个人私利。(5) 警察正在紧追逃犯。(6) 我们驾车沿着街道一路疾驶,都市的灯光不久就被抛在我们后面。(7) 你要是不努力学习,就会落后的。(8) 他不想在功课方面落后。(9) 我付款逾期了。(10) 她在出谏言献策方面从不落于人后。(11) 小汤姆在他屁股上踢了一脚。
[sound:youdao-f180c577-5b3ed911-ffe458ee-adb928ce-f00c43d9.mp3]

translation:
n. 存在; 生物; 人; 要素，本质

分布：人(70%)，存在(16%)，本质(7%)，生物(7%)


n.生物,生命,存在;Spell smell! Very well, the well-being for human being will swell.拼写气味(一词)!很好,人类的福利将会膨胀.



noun countable or uncountable  ADVANCED  ■a person or thing that exists or the state of existing 生命，生物
•A nuclear war would kill millions of living beings.一场核战会夺去数百万人的生命。

•Strange beings from outer space are still a popular subject for sci-fi films.外星人仍是不少科幻电影流行的主题。

•We do not know exactly how life first came into being (= began to exist.)我们不知道生命最初究竟是如何诞生的。

['bi:.ɪŋ] verb present participle of■be 



n. 存在；生命；本质；品格
 - presence, existence, entity, essence, personality, principle
adj. 存在的；现有的
 - visible, existent
examples: 英 ['biːɪŋ] 美 ['biːɪŋ]
n.存在；人；生物；本质

(1) I don't like being pent up in the house all the time.(2) It is fun eating by stealth without being found.(3) Earthenware has an advantage over wood in being more easily kept clean.(4) I have a feeling that we are being followed.(5) The ship was in imminent peril of being wrecked.(6) I detest violence with my whole being.(7) When did the world come into being?(8) What is the purpose of our being?
(1) 我不喜欢整天给关在屋子里。(2) 偷吃而不被人发现很有趣。(3) 陶器的优点在于比木器更容易保持清洁。(4) 我有种感觉我们正被人跟踪。(5) 那条船马上就有失事的危险。(6) 我毕生谴责暴力行为。(7) 世界是什么时候形成的？(8) 我们生存的目的是什么？
[sound:youdao-9702f836-2b896a5c-0a2d34de-1ffa4f4a-98d93153.mp3]

translation:
n. 信，信任; 信念，意见; 信条

分布：信仰(42%)，信念(32%)，相信(26%)


n.信任,相信,信念;信仰,信条That man has a strong belief in Buddhism.那个男子虔诚地信仰佛教.



noun countable or only singular or uncountable  ESSENTIAL  ■the feeling of being certain that something exists or is true 相信，信心；信仰
•All non-violent religious and political beliefs should be respected equally.对所有非暴力的宗教和政治信仰，应予以同等尊重。

•[+ that] It is my (firm) belief that nuclear weapons are immoral.我（坚定）相信，使用核武器是不道德的。

•His belief in God gave him hope during difficult times.他对上帝的信奉使他在困境中看到了希望。

•Recent revelations about corruption have shaken many people's belief in (= caused people to have doubts about) the police.不久前腐败事件的曝光动摇了许多人对警方的信任。

•He called at her house in the  belief  that (= confident that) she would lend him the money.他相信她会借钱给他，所以走到她家里去。
beyond belief ■too bad, good, difficult, etc. to be imagined 太坏、太好、太艰难等，以至于难以置信
•The brutality of the murders was beyond belief.凶手的手段残酷得令人难以置信。





belief, conviction, faith, trust, confidence, credit

这组词都有“相信，信任”的意思，其区别是：
belief: 普通用词，指单纯从主观上的相信，不着重这种相信是否有根据。
conviction: 多指根据长期交往或实践，对某人某事有了认识和了解后产生的信心和相信，侧重其坚定性。
faith: 语气较强，强调完全相信；有时也能仅凭感觉产生的相信。
trust: 强调相信、信任的完全可靠。
confidence: 指对某人某事有充分信心，断定不会使人失望，因而给予信任。
credit: 语气最弱，着重以声誉为信任的基础。


n. 相信，信赖；信仰；教义
 - faith, teaching, trust, doctrine
examples: 英 [bɪ'liːf] 美 [bɪ'liːf]
n.信念；信仰；相信

(1) It bolstered my belief.(2) He acted in accordance with his beliefs.(3) His belief of communism is immovable.(4) His firmness on his belief supported him in difficulties.(5) There was a happy chime of belief and practice in everything she said.(6) He has lost his belief in God.(7) The story of his miseries is beyond my belief.
(1) 这增强了我的信念。(2) 他按照自己的信念行事。(3) 他坚定不移地信仰共产主义。(4) 困境中，他坚定的信仰支撑着他。(5) 她所说的每一件事都体现了信仰和行动的完美和谐。(6) 他已不相信上帝了。(7) 他的悲惨身世令人难以置信。
[sound:youdao-cdb29038-74428887-b73a1dfd-2550e031-4fe0a33f.mp3]

translation:
v. 信任; 料想; 笃信宗教
vt. 相信; 以为，认为; 对…信以为真; 信任

时态：believed, believing, believes
分布：相信(77%)，认为(23%)


→前缀be-, 强调。-lieve, 爱，同love. 因为爱所以相信。
vt.相信,认为vi.相信,信任,信奉I believe my brief words will relieve her grief.我相信我简短的话会减轻她的悲痛.



verb transitive  ESSENTIAL  ■to think that something is true, correct or real 相信
•Strangely, no one believed us when we told them we'd been visited by a creature from Mars.奇怪的是，当我们告诉他们曾有火星人来访时，居然没人相信。

•[+ that] He believes that all children are born with equal intelligence.他相信孩子们出生时智商是一样的。

•She's arriving tomorrow, I believe.我相信她明天会到的。

•"Is she coming alone?" "We believe not/so (= We think she is not/is)."“她一个人来的吗？”“我想不是的／是的。”

•[+ obj + to infinitive] I believe her to be the finest violinist in the world.我相信她是世界上最出色的小提琴家。

•[+ obj + adj] All the crew are missing, believed dead.机组人员全告失踪，据说都已遇难。
not believe a word of it ■to not believe that something is true 根本不相信
•He told me she was just a friend, but I don't believe a word of it!他告诉我，她只是普通朋友而已，但我根本就不信！
believe it or not (also would you believe it?) ■said when telling someone about something that is true, although it seems unlikely 信不信由你
•He's upstairs doing his homework, believe it or not.他正在楼上做功课，信不信由你。
if you believe that, you'll believe anything! informal ■something that you say to emphasize that something is obviously not true 用于强调某事不可能是真的
•He said the car in front backed into him, and if you believe that, you'll believe anything!他说前面的车向后撞倒他。这根本就是胡说！
make believe ■to pretend or imagine 假装
•Let's make believe (that) we're pirates.我们假扮海盗吧。
⇒ See also make-believe
[bɪ'li:v] verb transitive believe sth when you see it ■If you say you will believe something when you see it, you mean you think it will not happen 直到亲眼看见才会相信
•"Hetty says she'll be here at 7.00." "I'll believe that when I see it."“赫蒂说她七点钟会来这里。”“除非我亲眼见到，否则我是不会相信的。”

[bɪ'li:v] verb transitive not believe your eyes/ears ■to be so surprised by what you see or hear that you think you are imagining it 简直不敢相信自己的眼睛／耳朵
•I couldn't believe my ears when she said they were getting divorced.当她说他们要离婚时，我简直不敢相信自己的耳朵。

[bɪ'li:v] verb transitive not believe your luck ■to be very surprised and very pleased 简直不敢相信自己有如此好运
[bɪ'li:v] verb transitive   Phrasal Verbs   believe in sth  ADVANCED  ■to be certain that something exists 确信，信奉
•Do you believe in ghosts?你相信有鬼吗？
 ADVANCED  ■to be confident that something is effective and right 对…有信心；认为…有效（或正确）
•They don't believe in living together before marriage.他们认为婚前同居不好。

•He believes in saying what he thinks.他认为说出自己的想法是对的。

[bɪ'li:v] verb transitive   Phrasal Verbs   believe in sb ■to trust someone because you think that they can do something well or that they are a good person 信任（某人）
•[R] Gradually, since her divorce, she's beginning to believe in herself again.自从离婚后，她渐渐开始对自己有信心了。

[bɪ'li:v] verb transitive   Common Learner Errors   believeWarning: Check your spelling!Believe is one of the 50 words most often spelled wrongly by learners.Remember: the correct spelling has 'ie'.




confide, rely, trust, believe

这组词都有“相信，信任”的意思，其区别是：
confide: 侧重忠诚可靠与可信赖。
rely: 指在相信的基础上可进一步依靠，着重可靠性。
trust: 指绝对相信或信赖某人。
believe: 普通用词，常表示一种缓和、不太肯定的口气。



reckon, think, count, consider, deem, regard, believe

这组词都有“认为”的意思，其区别是：
reckon: 指对人或事作全面“权衡”，把各方面意见考虑进去后得出结论。
think: 普通用词，指按照自己的意见提出看法。
count: 指作出判断后而得出的看法等。
consider: 指经过考虑和观察后得出的结论。
deem: 正式用词，常用于法律、文学，强调作判断而不是思考。
regard: 侧重凭外表或表面现象作判断。多强调观点。
believe: 通常指根据一定的证据，经思考后而认为属实。


vi. 信任；料想；笃信宗教
 - trust on, suppose
vt. 相信；认为；信任
 - expect, count, guess, find, feel
examples: 英 [bɪ'liːv] 美 [bɪ'liːv]
v.相信；认为
(1) We believe in his ability.(2) Some people believe in God and others don't.(3) Some people believe poverty engenders crime.(4) They believe it is essential to defy convention.
(1) 我们相信他的才干。(2) 有人相信上帝; 有人则不相信。(3) 有人认为贫困生罪恶。(4) 他们认为反抗流俗是绝对必要的。
[sound:youdao-93633ea8-fa2c731a-026f6ec3-40b96ac9-4834b756.mp3]

translation:
n. 钟，铃; 钟声，铃声; 钟状物; [建]圆屋顶
vt. 敲钟; 系铃于，给…装上铃; 使成铃状; 把…放在钟形罩内
vi. 使象钟状地张开; 鸣钟

时态：belled, belling, bells
分布：铃(51%)，钟(27%)，钟声(10%)，门铃(7%)，敲钟(2%)，钟状物(1%)，使象钟状地张开(1%)，使呈钟状(1%)


→来自PIE *bhel-(3), 发声，怒吼，拟声词。
n.钟,铃The cell seller seldom sees the bell belt melt.小单间的卖主很少见到铃铛带子融化.



noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■a hollow metal object shaped like a cup which makes a ringing sound when hit by something hard, especially a clapper 钟，铃
•The church bells rang out to welcome in the New Year.教堂的钟声响起，迎接新年的到来。

•I stood at the front door and rang the bell several times.我在前门按了好几次门铃。

[bel] noun countable bells and whistles ■extra features which make something more attractive, useful, etc. 附加特色，点缀品
•That software has all the usual functions plus the latest bells and whistles.除了常用的功能，这软体还具备一些新颖的附加功能。

[bel] noun countable give sb a bell UK informal ■to telephone someone 给（某人）打电话
•Give me a bell sometime next week, won't you?下星期给我电话好吗？

[bel] noun countable  warning / alarm bells start to ring / sound ■used to describe an occasion when you realize that something is wrong 敲响警钟
•When Frank suggested coming to stay for a couple of days, alarm bells started to ring in my head.法兰克说要过来住上几天时，我的脑海里响起了警钟。

[bel] noun countable with bells on US informal ■To do something or go somewhere with bells on is to do it or go there eagerly 热切地
•"Are you coming to Paul's tonight." "Sure, I'll be there - with bells on."“你今晚会去保罗家吗？”“我当然会去——我都迫不急待了。”




n. 铃，钟；钟声，铃声；钟状物
 - ring, gong
vi. 鸣钟；成钟状鼓起
 - toll
examples: 英 [bel] 美 [bel]
n.钟；铃；门铃；钟声；钟状物vt.敲钟；使象钟状地张开vi.使呈钟状；张开

(1) The church bell tolled the hour.(2) I was roused by the sound of the bell this morning.(3) I was too preoccupied to hear the bell.(4) The church bell calls up my wedding day.(5) The young monk clangs the bell every morning.(6) Lots of bell ringers were killed by lightning.(7) The thief got flurried,thinking that it was too bad to have produced the crashiing sound which would himself on the bell,trying to muffle the crashing sound with his arms.
(1) 教堂的鸣钟报时。(2) 今天早晨，我被铃声唤醒。(3) 当时我出神地想着心事，没有听见门铃响。(4) 教堂的钟声使我想起了我结婚的那天。(5) 年幼的和尚每天早晨当当地敲钟。(6) 许多敲钟人被闪电击毙。(7) 他心里一急，身子一下子扑到了钟上，张开双臂想捂住钟声，可钟声又怎么捂得住呢！
[sound:youdao-bf8bc7f4-7c71770d-a71df538-56ecdeee-9ebeb9cb.mp3]

translation:
adj. 被热爱的; 亲爱的; 为…所爱的
n. 心爱的人，可爱的人; 情人; 亲爱的教友

分布：心爱的(79%)，爱人(21%)
