translation:
vt. 建造，构筑; 建立; 开发; 为…建立基础
vi. 建造，营造; 扩大，扩展; 发展，达到
n. 体格，构造; 〈俚〉优美的体型，肉体美

时态：built, building, builds
分布：建造(67%)，开发(12%)，体格(10%)，创建(5%)，身材(5%)，逐渐增强(1%)


→来自PIE *bheue, 存在，生长，居住。词源同booth, bothy.
vt.建造,建筑;建设,建立vi.增大,增强In the building, the wild child hurt his mild chin on the china.在大楼里,那个粗野的孩子在瓷器上弄伤了温柔的下巴.



verb (built, built) ESSENTIAL  intransitive or transitive ■to make something by putting bricks or other materials together 建造，修建
•They're building new houses by the river.他们正在河边建新房子。

•The birds built their nest in the small fir tree.鸟儿们在小冷杉树上筑巢。

•These old houses are built (= made) of stone.这些老房子是用石头砌的。

•Contractors have started building on waste land near the town.承包商开始在离城镇不远的废弃土地上建房。
transitive ■to create and develop something over a long period of time 建立；发展；开辟
•We want to build a better future for our children.我们想为孩子创造更美好的未来。

[bɪld] verb (built, built)build bridges ■to improve relationships between people who are very different or do not like each other 改善或加强不同（或敌对）人士或组群间的关系
•A local charity is working to build bridges between different ethnic groups in the area.一家地方慈善机构正努力在这个地区不同的族群间架设友谊的桥梁。

[bɪld] verb (built, built) Rome wasn't built in a day. saying ■said to emphasize that you can not expect to do important things in a short period of time 罗马不是一天建成的；伟业非一日之功
[bɪld] verb (built, built)  Phrasal Verbs   [usually passive] build around sth ■to base something on an idea or principle 以…为基础
•The independence movement sought to unify the country with a national identity built around a common language.独立运动谋求以建立在共同语言基础上的民族认同感来统一国家。

[bɪld] verb (built, built)  Phrasal Verbs   build sth in/into sth ■to include something as part of a plan, system or agreement （使）包括；使成为（计划、系统或协议的）组成部分
•When drawing up a contract it is vital to build in safety measures.草拟合同时，将安全措施包括在内很重要。

•figurative Inequalities are often built into (= cannot be separated from) society.社会中往往会存在不平等现象。

[bɪld] verb (built, built)  Phrasal Verbs   build on sth ■to use a success or achievement as a base from which to achieve more success 基于，依赖，以…为基础
•We must build on our reputation to expand the business.我们必须依靠信誉来扩展业务。

•A good relationship is built on trust.良好的关系建立在信任的基础上。

[bɪld] verb (built, built)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] build (sb/sth) up ■to increase or become larger or stronger, or to cause someone or something to do this 增强，加强；增大
•Tension is building up between the two communities.两个社区之间的关系日趋紧张。

•They gave him soup to build up his strength /build him up.他们给他喝汤以增强体质。

•It took her ten years to build up her publishing business.她花了十年时间将她的出版事业发展壮大。

[bɪld] verb (built, built)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] build sth/sb up ■to praise something or someone in a way which will influence people's opinions 赞扬；吹捧
•For weeks the media has been building up the national basketball team.媒体几周来一直在吹捧国家篮球队。

[bɪld] verb (built, built)  Common Learner Errors   build up or build?To talk about making something by putting bricks or other materials together, don't say 'build up', say build :✗ The new supermarket will be built up next to the park.The new supermarket will be built next to the park.
[bɪld] noun countable or uncountable ■the size and shape of a person's body 身材，体形
•She was of slim build with short, dark hair.她身材苗条，一头黑色的短发。





put up, set up, build, found

put up: 临时搭建, put up a tent,
set up: 建成(内部的设施基本齐全), set up a school
build: 一般用语,建成,
found: 国家或组织的建成



erect, establish, set up, construct, build, found

这组词都有“建设，建立，建造”的意思，其区别是：
erect: 侧重指对高而垂直物的建造。使用不如build广泛。
establish: 着重稳固地建成，可具体指国家、政府、学校或商店等的建立，也可指信仰、信用、名誉、法律、制度、规则等的建立。
set up: 作“建立”用时，侧重于“开始”。可指具体或抽象的建立。
construct: 较正式用词，强调根据一定计划进行的规模较大，结构较复杂，要求较高技术的建造。
build: 普通用词，含义广泛，可指一切具体或抽象的建造或建立。
found: 侧重打下基础或创办，具体或抽象事物均可用。


vt. 建立；建筑
 - establish, found, constitute
vi. 建筑；建造
 - engineer, put up
n. 构造；体形；体格
 - formation, constructing, fabric, structure, figure
examples: 英 [bɪld] 美 [bɪld]
v.建造；开发；创建；逐渐增强n.体格；身材

(1) That house is built of bricks.(2) It is not an easy task to build a business.(3) We should study hard to build a better future for ourselves.(4) His analysis build up their confidence.(5) We must build up a reserve fund to meet emergencies.(6) She really did not have the build for a ballerina.(7) That girl is of proportional build and is beautiful.
(1) 那座房子是砖造的。(2) 创业并不是一件容易的事情。(3) 我们应该努力学习,为自己创造更美好的未来。(4) 他的分析增强了他们的信心。(5) 我们必须逐渐积累一笔储蓄以备急需。(6) 她实际上并没有一个芭蕾舞女演员的体格。(7) 那少女身材匀称，长相漂亮。
[sound:youdao-1f4e0dfb-9110237e-a51269a8-ef0229a7-08e172e4.mp3]

translation:
n. 建筑物; 楼房; 房屋; 建筑（艺术或行业）
v. build的现在分词

分布：建筑物(100%)


建筑物(build建造)[-ing 1.表名词"状态"2.表名词"行业"3.表形容词"正…的","令人…的"]
n.建筑(物),房屋,大楼[同]structureCitizens in the city's civil buildings are all civilized.城市民用建筑内的市民全都得到教化.



noun countable or uncountable  ESSENTIAL  ■a structure with walls and a roof such as a house or factory, or the business of making these 建筑物；房屋；建筑；建筑业
•The once-empty site was now covered with buildings.一度空荡荡的地方现在布满了建筑物。

•He started off in the building trade before opening his own restaurant.在开餐馆以前他做建筑生意起家。





structure, building

这组词都有“建筑物”的意思，其区别是：
structure: 侧重建筑物的构造形式。
building: 普通用词，指任何建筑物，但不涉及建筑物的大小、风格以及所用材料。



home, building, residence, shelter, dwelling, habitation, house

这组词都有“居住处”的意思，其区别是：
home: 指永久住家时，带有家庭所特有的温暖、情感等气息。
building: 泛指一切建筑物，不限于居住的房子。
residence: 指大而堂皇的寓所或公馆，也指法律上的居住点。
shelter: 可指长期或临时的住处，也指简陋或临时搭建的躲避风雨的场所。
dwelling: 正式用词，仅指人们居住的任何建筑物。
habitation: 指长久或固定的住所或居住地。
house: 中性词，泛指一切供居住的建筑物，尤指适合一家一户居住的房屋。


n. [建] 建筑；建筑物
 - construction, fabric, structure, bldg
v. [建] 建筑；建立；增加（build的ing形式）
 - establishing, adding, increasing
examples: 英 ['bɪldɪŋ] 美 ['bɪldɪŋ]
n.建筑物

(1) The heat had blistered the paint of the building.(2) The building faces north.(3) The building does not conform to safety regulations.(4) Houses and churches are buildings.(5) The erection of the building took several months.(6) The force of the explosion broke all the windows in the building.
(1) 酷热使建筑物上的油漆起了浮泡。(2) 这栋建筑物朝北。(3) 这座建筑物不符合安全条例。(4) 房子和教堂是建筑物。(5) 建造这座建筑物花了好几个月时间。(6) 爆炸的力量震碎了这座建筑上的所有窗户。
[sound:youdao-2655bea5-01db79f5-229f65ea-5e132c00-45ec35f1.mp3]

translation:
n. 球茎，块茎植物; 电灯泡; [解剖学]肿块

分布：电灯泡(69%)，球茎(23%)，球状物(8%)


→词源同ball, 膨胀，鼓起，球。
n.灯泡,球状物The bulk of the ruby rubbish on the pebble bubbles when stirred by bulbed rubber club.小卵石上的大部分红宝石废料在用有球状突起的橡胶短棍搅动是会起泡.
【参】bulbous（adj 球根的，球根长成的）；bulb作词根：圆



noun countable PLANT  植物  ■a round root of some plants from which the plant grows 球茎，鳞茎
•tulip bulbs郁金香球茎

[bʌlb] noun countable LIGHT  灯  ■a light bulb 



n. [电] 电灯泡； [植] 鳞茎；球状物
 - third wheel, electric lamp
examples: 英 [bʌlb] 美 [bʌlb]
n.球茎；电灯泡；球状物
(1) Onions and lilies grow from bulbs.(2) This light bulb has gone.(3) The light bulb imploded.(4) I can see clearly that the filament in the bulb is broken.
(1) 洋葱和百合是从球茎中长出的。(2) 这灯泡不亮了。(3) 这灯泡是向内侧爆裂的。(4) 我可以很清楚地看到灯泡里的细丝断了。
[sound:youdao-3e426c48-245dcc52-7d1d8b29-504bc980-4f9ede44.mp3]

translation:
n. （大）体积; 大块，大量; 大多数，大部分; 主体
vt. & vi. 变得越来越大（或重要）
vi. 显得庞大; 形成大块; 堆积起来
vt. 使凝聚成一团或形成一堆
adj. 大批的，大量的; 散装的

时态：bulked, bulking, bulks
分布：大部分(35%)，体积(19%)，大量的(11%)，大块(9%)，散装的(5%)，容积(5%)，大批(4%)，显得重要(4%)，膨胀(3%)，使膨胀(3%)，使成堆(2%)


→词源同ball, 膨胀，鼓起，球。
n.体积,容积;主体,大批,大量,大块The bulk of the ruby rubbish on the pebble bubbles when stirred by bulbed rubber club.小卵石上的大部分红宝石废料在用有球状突起的橡胶短棍搅动是会起泡.
【记】读：宝库。既有体积，又有数量。



noun countable usually singular ■something or someone that is very large 巨大的东西；大块，大团
•She eased her large bulk out of the chair.她缓缓地将她那庞大的身躯从椅子上挪开。
uncountable ■large size or mass 大规模；大量
•It was a document of surprising bulk.这是一份篇幅惊人的文件。
in bulk ■in large amounts 大量，批量
•The office buys paper in bulk to keep down costs.办公室大量买进纸张以减少成本。
the bulk of sth ■most of something 大部分
•In fact, the bulk of the book is taken up with criticizing other works.事实上，这本书大部分篇幅都是在批评其他作品。
bulk buy ■to buy in large amounts 大批购买
•Because we're such a large family we find it cheaper to bulk buy foods we eat a lot of.因为我们是一大家人，我们发现大批量购买消耗量大的食物更便宜。

[bʌlk] verb bulk large literary ■to be present and important 显得重要
•Fears of his death bulked large in her thoughts.对他可能会去世的恐惧和担忧一直笼罩在她心头。

[bʌlk] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [M] bulk sth out ■to make something bigger or thicker by adding something 使增大；使增厚
•I added some potatoes to the stew to bulk it out.我往炖菜里加了些马铃薯，使它量更足。




n. 体积，容量；大多数，大部分；大块
 - most of, volume, content
vt. 使扩大，使形成大量；使显得重要
 - exaggerate, broaden
examples: 英 [bʌlk] 美 [bʌlk]
n.体积；容积；大块；大部分；大批adj.散装的；大量的vt.使膨胀；使成堆vi.膨胀；显得重要

(1) It's not their weight that makes these sacks hard to carry, it's their bulk.(2) He heaved his huge bulk out of the chair.(3) The bulk of the work has already been done.(4) The great bulk of necessary work can never be anything but painful.(5) We can manage some bulk carrier within two week.(6) I recommend you a bulk buy.(7) A dozen petticoats bulked out her figure.(8) The cake bulked up.(9) The war still bulks large in the memories of those who fought in it.
(1) 这些袋子难以搬运,倒不是因为重而是体积太大。(2) 他挺起巨大的身躯，从椅子上站了起来。(3) 大部分工作已经完成。(4) 大量必须做的工作真令人痛苦。(5) 我们可在两周内安排一些散装船去。(6) 我建议你大量购买。(7) 十几条衬裙把她的身体撑得圆鼓鼓的。(8) 蛋糕发起来了。(9) 对于那些曾参战的人来说,那场战争仍记忆犹新。

translation:
n. 子弹，弹药; 弹丸; [印]着重号

分布：子弹(98%)，弹丸(2%)


→bull, 词源同ball. -et, 小词后缀。
枪弹(bull=ball球＋et→小球→子弹)[ball,bol=throw,dance,ball,表示"抛,舞,球"]
n.子弹,枪弹Bullet-proof glass stops bullets from passing through.防弹玻璃子弹射不透.



noun countable  IMPROVER  ■a small, metal object that is shot from a gun 子弹
•A bullet had lodged in the boy's leg.一颗子弹嵌进了男孩的腿里。
■* a bullet point 




shell, bullet

这两个名词均与枪弹有关。
shell: 指发射后会爆炸的炮弹。
bullet: 含义广泛，指各种枪用的子弹。


n. [军] 子弹；只选某党全部候选人的投票；豆子
 - pill
vi. 射出；迅速行进
 - jet, shoot out
examples: 英 ['bʊlɪt] 美 ['bʊlɪt]
n.子弹；弹丸

(1) He grunted as the bullet hit him.(2) A bullet whizzed past my ear.(3) The bullet went clean through his arm.(4) The bullet hit him in the chest.(5) The bullet was expelled from the gun.(6) So far there is no magic bullet for economic woes.
(1) 子弹击中他时他疼得哼了出来。(2) 一颗子弹嗖的一声从我耳边飞过。(3) 子弹穿过他的手臂。(4) 子弹击中了他的胸膛。(5) 子弹从枪中射出。(6) 到目前为止还没有解决经济困难的妙法。
[sound:youdao-b6453329-d1ce24c1-a3a2dfc1-7c76db69-9adcc7dc.mp3]

translation:
n. 束，串，捆; 一串，一群; 一帮，一伙; [非正式用语]大量
vt. 聚成一串，形成一串; 聚成一组; 使起褶：使（织物）起褶
vi. 形成一串，形成一组; 打褶; 膨胀，凸出

时态：bunched, bunching, bunches
分布：束(36%)，一群(29%)，串(21%)，捆(8%)，隆起(4%)，突出物(1%)，成束成群(1%)


→词源不详。一说来自bun, 块状。一说来自band 变体，band, 绑。
n.(一)簇,束,捆,串I bundled a bunch of branches and anchored it on the punching bench.我捆起一簇树枝,将它栓在冲压工作台上.



noun GROUP  组   IMPROVER  countable ■a number of things of the same type fastened together or in a close group 串，束，扎
•a bunch of flowers/grapes/bananas/keys一束花／一串葡萄／一串香蕉／一串锁匙

•mainly US informal The reorganization will give us a whole bunch (= a lot) of problems.重组将会给我们带来许多问题。
only singular ■a group of people 一帮人
•They're a bunch of hooligans.他们是一帮流氓。

•Your friends are a nice bunch.你的一帮朋友都很好。
the best/pick of the bunch ■the best person or thing from a group of similar people or things 出类拔萃的人（或物）；精英；精品
•Send in your poems and we'll publish the pick of the bunch.把你的诗歌寄过来，我们将择优出版。

[bʌntʃ] noun HAIRSTYLE  发型  bunches UK [plural] ■If a girl has her hair in bunches, it is tied together in two parts with one at each side of her head. （扎在头两侧的）小辫
•As a little girl she wore her hair in bunches.小时候她把头发梳成两个小辫。

[bʌntʃ] noun a bunch of fives old-fashioned slang ■If you give someone a bunch of fives, you hit them hard with your hand closed. 一拳痛击
[bʌntʃ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   bunch (sth) up/together ■to move close together to form a tight group （使）聚拢；（使）挤成一团；（把…）聚成一堆
•The monkeys bunched together in their cage.猴子在笼中挤成一团。

•We were all bunched up at the back of the room.我们都挤在房间的后面。

[bʌntʃ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [M] bunch (sth) up ■If material bunches up, or if someone bunches it up, it moves into tight folds （把…）团成一团；（使）打褶
•Your shirt's all bunched up at the back.你的衬衣后面都是褶。





parcel, package, bundle, bunch, packet, pack

这组词都有“捆，包”的意思，其区别是：
parcel: 着重指邮包，也指将东西扎成小包或不太大的包。
package: 指包装整齐严密的包裹或一包、一捆、一盒东西。
bundle: 指多件东西被捆扎在一起。
bunch: 指有规则地把同类东西固定在一起。
packet: 一般指小件行李、邮包、还可指更小一些的包。
pack: 指专为背负而包扎的包裹，也指驮物等。


n. 群；串；突出物
 - cluster, gang, qun
vi. 隆起；打褶；形成一串
 - fix pleats
examples: 英 [bʌntʃ] 美 [bʌntʃ]
n.串；束；一群；捆n.突出物；凸起vt.使成一束(或一群等)vi.隆起；成束成群

(1) I bought a bunch of grapes.(2) He gave a bunch of flowers to his girlfriend.(3) He goes round with a bunch of thugs.(4) Be sure not to bunch the flowers up tightly.(5) Don't bunch up all the candlesticks in one corner of the shelf.(6) His arm muscles bunch out when he lift the stone lion.(7) Spread out more. Don't bunch up on the centre.
(1) 我买了一串葡萄。(2) 他送给女友一束花。(3) 他经常和一帮流氓厮混。(4) 务必不要把花束捆得太紧。(5) 不要把蜡烛台全部捆在一起放在架子的一个角上。(6) 他举起石狮时臂上的肌肉一块一块隆起。(7) 再散开一点，不要都挤在中间。
[sound:youdao-d3fcd8ef-0415df03-f2dd14f5-0e946830-2849027d.mp3]

translation:
n. 捆; 一批（同类事物或出售的货品）; 一大笔钱; 风趣的人
vt. & vi. 收集，归拢，把…塞入
vt. 额外免费提供（设备等），（尤指出售计算机时）赠送软件
vi. 匆匆送走; 推搡; 赶; （成群地）匆忙赶往

时态：bundled, bundling, bundles
分布：包(37%)，束(32%)，捆(28%)，大笔钱(1%)，匆忙地走(1%)，把 ... 扎成一捆(1%)


→bund, 同band, 绑。-le, 小词后缀。
n.捆,包,束My grandpa sent me a large bundle on my birthday.我生日时爷爷给我寄来一个大包裹.



noun countable  ADVANCED  ■a number of things that have been fastened or are held together 束，捆
•a bundle of clothes/newspapers/books一捆衣服／报纸／书

•a bundle of sticks一捆柴火

['bʌn.dl] noun countable bundle of joy ■a baby 婴孩
•Three days after the birth, Paul and Sandra took their precious bundle of joy home.孩子出生三天后，保罗和桑德拉把宝宝抱回了家。

['bʌn.dl] noun countable a bundle of laughs informal ■a funny, entertaining person or situation 好笑的人（或情景）；笑料
•He's not exactly a bundle of laughs, is he?他并不是个很滑稽搞笑的人，是不是？

['bʌn.dl] noun countable a bundle of nerves informal ■someone who is extremely nervous and worried 焦躁的人；紧张不安的人
•Sorry for shouting - I'm a bundle of nerves these days.很抱歉冲你大叫大嚷——这些天我很焦躁。

['bʌn.dl] noun countable go a bundle on sth UK informal ■to like something very much 非常喜欢
•usually in negative I don't go a bundle on his taste in clothes.我不太喜欢他的衣着品味。

['bʌn.dl] noun countable make a bundle informal ■to earn a lot of money 赚取大量金钱
•They made a bundle selling their business.他们卖掉他们的公司，大赚了一笔。

['bʌn.dl] verb PUSH  推  intransitive or transitive [+ adv/prep] ■to push or put someone or something somewhere quickly and roughly 推搡；匆匆送走；乱堆；乱塞
•He bundled his clothes into the washing machine.他把衣服塞进洗衣机里。

•She was bundled into the back of the car.她被匆匆推进了车后座上。

•The children were bundled off to school early that morning.那天一大早孩子们就被匆匆送往学校。

['bʌn.dl] verb SELL TOGETHER  一起卖  transitive ■to include an extra computer program or other product with something that you sell 捆绑销售（电脑软体等）；搭售
•The system came bundled with a word processor, spreadsheet and graphics program.这个系统销售时还外带文字处理、电子制表和图像制作软体。

['bʌn.dl] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [M] bundle (sb) up ■to put warm clothes on yourself or someone else （使某人）穿得暖和
•The kids were bundled up in coats and scarves.孩子们穿着大衣，系着围巾，裹得严严实实。

['bʌn.dl] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [M] bundle sth up ■to tie a number of things together 把…捆扎起来




parcel, package, bundle, bunch, packet, pack

这组词都有“捆，包”的意思，其区别是：
parcel: 着重指邮包，也指将东西扎成小包或不太大的包。
package: 指包装整齐严密的包裹或一包、一捆、一盒东西。
bundle: 指多件东西被捆扎在一起。
bunch: 指有规则地把同类东西固定在一起。
packet: 一般指小件行李、邮包、还可指更小一些的包。
pack: 指专为背负而包扎的包裹，也指驮物等。


n. [解剖] 束； [印刷] 捆
 - tract, truss
vt. [印刷] 捆
 - rope
vi. 匆忙离开
 - bolt out, blow through
examples: 英 ['bʌndl] 美 ['bʌndl]
n.捆；束；包；大笔钱v.捆；把 ... 扎成一捆；匆忙地走

(1) He collected a bundle of sticks.(2) I see a bundle of firewood on the floor.(3) On the table there is a bundle of flower.(4) My uncle sent me a large bundle on my birthday.(5) The heavy bundle bore him down.(6) That car must have cost a bundle.(7) Can you bundle up the sheets for me?(8) She bundled her son off to school.
(1) 他收集了一捆树枝。(2) 我看见了一捆劈柴在地板上。(3) 桌子上有一束花。(4) 我生日时叔父给我寄来一个大包裹。(5) 那包东西很重，压得他直不起腰。(6) 这辆汽车一定值很多钱。(7) 你能替我将这些单子捆起来吗?(8) 她匆匆忙忙把儿子打发到学校去了。
[sound:youdao-7496eada-5680a0de-4bf0bc26-339b0f3f-d52aa8bd.mp3]

translation:
n. 负担，包袱; 责任，义务; 载货量; （诗歌，发言等的）重点
vt. 使烦恼，劳累; 向（车，船等）上装货

时态：burdened, burdening, burdens
分布：负担(77%)，责任(15%)，烦扰(3%)，装载(2%)，使负重(1%)，主题(1%)，装载量(1%)


→来自bear, 承担，承载。
n.担子,重担,负担vt.给予负担或麻烦Banned murders in the suburb bring turbulent disturbance and burden to the urban turbine works.在郊区被禁止的谋杀给都市透平工厂带来汹涌骚乱和重负.



US ['bɝ:-] noun countable  IMPROVER  ■a heavy load that you carry 负荷，重负
•The little donkey struggled under its heavy burden.小毛驴驮着重物艰难前行。
■something difficult or unpleasant that you have to deal with or worry about 负担，重担
•the burden of responsibility责任的重担

•My elderly mother worries that she's a  burden  to me.我年迈的母亲担心她成为我的拖累。

•Buying a house often places a large  financial burden on young couples.买房子往往会让年轻夫妇背上沉重的经济负担。

UK ['bɜ:.dən] US ['bɝ:-] noun countable the burden of proof legal ■the responsibility for proving something 举证责任
UK ['bɜ:.dən] US ['bɝ:-] verb transitive ■to trouble someone with something difficult or unpleasant 负担，重担
•I don't want to burden you with my problems.我不想拿我的困难烦扰你。





burden, load, cargo

这组词都有“负担，负荷”的意思，其区别是：
burden: 指沉重、令人不快的负担；指精神负担时常有不堪忍受的意味。
load: 普通用词，含义广泛，指人、畜、车、船等负载的东西，指精神负担时，可与burden换用，但无感情色彩。
cargo: 指用轮船、车辆或飞机长距离运载的货物。


n. 负担；责任；船的载货量
 - liability, duty, weight, strain, trust
vt. 使负担；烦扰；装货于
 - eat, bother
examples: 英 ['bɜːdn] 美 ['bɜːrdn]
n.负担；责任；装载量；主题；[音乐]副歌v.使负重；装载；烦扰

(1) The burden on his back seemed to be crushing him to the earth.(2) People on high incomes face a huge tax burden.(3) The burden of organizing the campaign fell to me.(4) I don't want to lay a burden on you.(5) The burden of his argument was that life is precious.(6) I don't want to burden you with my problem.
(1) 他背上的重负似乎要把他压倒在地。(2) 高收入的人面临着沉重的纳税负担。(3) 组织这次活动的责任落到了我头上。(4) 我不想让你承担责任。(5) 他论证的要点是生命是宝贵的。(6) 我不想让我的问题给你添麻烦。

translation:
n. 局; （提供某方面信息的）办事处; （美国政府部门）局; （附抽屉及活动写字台的）书桌

分布：局(96%)，办事处(4%)


→来自拉丁词burra, 羊毛，粗糙的布，桌布。代指办公室。词源同bur, 芒刺，形容布粗糙。
n.署,局,司,处In the beautiful bureau my daughter's laughter served for the sauce of the sausage.在漂亮的办公署,女儿的笑声充当了香肠的调料.



US ['bjʊr.oʊ] (plural bureaux or  US USUALLY bureaus)noun countable ORGANIZATION  机构  ■an organization or a business that collects or provides information （搜集或提供资讯的）办事处，办公室，机构
•Her disappearance was reported to the police department's Missing Persons Bureau.她的失踪被提报到了警察局的失踪人口调查处。
■mainly US ■a government organization （政府部门的）局，处，科
•the Federal Bureau of Investigation联邦调查局

UK ['bjʊə.rəʊ] US ['bjʊr.oʊ] (plural bureaux or  US USUALLY bureaus)noun countable FURNITURE  家俱  UK  a piece of furniture with a lid that opens to form a writing surface 书桌US for * chest of drawers 



n. [管理] 局，处；衣柜； [家具] 办公桌
 - department, innings
examples: 英 ['bjʊərəʊ] 美 ['bjʊroʊ]
n.局；办事处；(带抽屉的）写字台
(1) He works in this bureau.(2) The travel bureau is not so far from here.(3) He worked in a travel bureau.(4) He picked up that bureau at a second-hand store.
(1) 他在这个局工作过。(2) 旅游局离这里不远。(3) 他在一家旅行社工作。(4) 这个柜子是他在一家旧货店买的。
[sound:youdao-d94eb0d7-bb39eaae-9170acb2-69578169-5a18ec79.mp3]

translation:
vt. & vi.& link-v. （使）燃烧
vt. & vi. 使用某物为燃料; 烧毁; 烧坏; 烧伤
n. 烧伤，烧痕

时态：burned, burnt, burning, burns
分布：烧伤(48%)，燃烧(37%)，灼伤(6%)，烧毁(6%)，烧着(2%)，急于(1%)


→来自PIE *bher, 燃烧，发光，加热。词源同brew.
v.燃烧,烧着;烧毁;灼伤n.烧伤,灼伤They returned in turn to bury the luxuries burnt in the burst.他们依次返回来埋藏在爆炸中烧毁的奢侈品.



US [bɝ:n] verb (burnt or burned, burnt or burned)DAMAGE  损坏   ESSENTIAL  intransitive or transitive ■to (cause something to) be hurt, damaged or destroyed by fire or extreme heat （把…）烧坏，（使）烧伤，（使）烧毁；（使）晒伤；（使）烫伤
•He was badly burnt in the blaze.他在大火中严重烧伤。

•She burnt his old love letters.她烧掉了他的旧日情书。

•The brandy burned (= felt too hot on) my throat.白兰地喝下去后我感到喉咙里火辣辣的。

•On her first day in the Caribbean Josie was badly burned (= her skin became red and painful from too much sun).到加勒比海的第一天，乔西就晒伤了。

•Fair-skinned people burn easily in the sun.白皮肤的人很容易晒伤。

•Unable to escape, six people were burnt alive /burnt to death (= died by burning) in the building.由于未能逃脱，有六个人在大楼里被活活烧死。

•The vegetables were burnt to a crisp (= badly burnt).蔬菜烧焦了。
transitive always passive ■to cause emotional pain or damage to someone 给…造成感情伤害burn sb at the stake ■to kill someone by tying them to a post and burning them 对（某人）处以火刑burn sth to the ground ■to completely destroy a building by fire 彻底烧毁
•The building was burned to the ground ten years ago.这幢建筑十年前被烧毁了。

UK [bɜ:n] US [bɝ:n] verb (burnt or burned, burnt or burned)PRODUCE FLAMES  燃烧   ESSENTIAL  intransitive ■to be on fire, or to produce flames 着火；烧着；燃烧
•The wood was wet and would not burn.木头湿了，烧不着。

•Helplessly we watched our house burning.我们无助地看着房子在燃烧。

•A fire was burning brightly in the fireplace.壁炉里火烧得正旺。

UK [bɜ:n] US [bɝ:n] verb (burnt or burned, burnt or burned)PRODUCE LIGHT  发光  intransitive ■to produce light 发光
•I saw a light burning in her window.我看见了她窗口的灯光。

UK [bɜ:n] US [bɝ:n] verb (burnt or burned, burnt or burned)FEEL HOT  感到热  intransitive ■If your face burns, it feels very hot （脸）发烧
•His face burned with embarrassment/shame/anger.他因尴尬／羞愧／愤怒而感到脸上发烫。

UK [bɜ:n] US [bɝ:n] verb (burnt or burned, burnt or burned)WANT  渴望  [+ to infinitive] ■to want to do something very much 迫不及待地想（做某事）；渴望
•She was burning to tell us her news.她迫不及待想把她的消息告诉我们。

UK [bɜ:n] US [bɝ:n] verb (burnt or burned, burnt or burned)COPY  复制  transitive ■to copy information, recorded music, images, etc. onto a CD 把（资料、音乐、图片等）复制（到光碟上）；刻录；烧录
•Burn your favourite songs or your important files onto CDs.把你最喜欢的歌曲或重要的文件烧录到光碟上。

UK [bɜ:n] US [bɝ:n] verb (burnt or burned, burnt or burned)burn your boats/bridges ■If you are in a situation and you burn your boats/bridges, you destroy all possible ways of going back to that situation. 自断退路；破釜沉舟
UK [bɜ:n] US [bɝ:n] verb (burnt or burned, burnt or burned) burn a hole in sb's pocket ■If money is burning a hole in your pocket, you are very eager to spend it. （某人）钱在口袋里留不住，一有钱就想花
UK [bɜ:n] US [bɝ:n] verb (burnt or burned, burnt or burned) burn the candle at both ends ■to work or do other things from early in the morning until late at night and so get very little rest 劳累过度
UK [bɜ:n] US [bɝ:n] verb (burnt or burned, burnt or burned) burn the midnight oil ■to work late into the night 工作到深夜；熬夜工作
UK [bɜ:n] US [bɝ:n] verb (burnt or burned, burnt or burned)get/have your fingers burnt (also burn your fingers) informal ■to suffer unpleasant results of an action, especially loss of money, so you do not want to do the same thing again （因错误决定而）吃亏，蒙受损失，（尤指）遭受金钱损失
•She'd invested extensively in stocks and got her fingers burnt when the market collapsed.她在股市上大量投资，结果股市崩溃损失惨重。

UK [bɜ:n] US [bɝ:n] verb (burnt or burned, burnt or burned)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] burn (sth) down ■to destroy something, especially a building, by fire, or to be destroyed by fire 烧毁，焚毁（尤指建筑物）
•He tried to burn down the school by setting fire to papers on a noticeboard.他放火点燃了贴在布告板上的报纸，妄图烧毁学校。

UK [bɜ:n] US [bɝ:n] verb (burnt or burned, burnt or burned)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] burn sth off/up ■to use or get rid of energy or fat by doing a lot of physical exercise （透过大量体育锻炼）消耗（能量或脂肪）
•Running is an excellent way to burn off excess calories.跑步是消耗多余热量的极好办法。

UK [bɜ:n] US [bɝ:n] verb (burnt or burned, burnt or burned)  Phrasal Verbs   burn out FIRE  ■If a fire burns out, it stops producing flames because nothing remains that can burn. （火）烧尽BREAK  ■If something such as a motor burns out, it stops working because of damage from heat （马达等因过热）烧坏，出故障
•It looks like the starter motor on the car has burnt out.看起来像是汽车引擎的启动装置被烧坏了。

UK [bɜ:n] US [bɝ:n] verb (burnt or burned, burnt or burned)  Phrasal Verbs   [R] burn yourself out ■to be forced to stop working because you have become ill or very tired from working too hard 把（自己）累垮
•Stop working so hard - you'll burn yourself out.工作别这么拼命——你会累垮的。
⇒ See also burn-out
UK [bɜ:n] US [bɝ:n] verb (burnt or burned, burnt or burned)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] burn (sth) up ■to destroy something completely with fire or heat, or to be destroyed completely by fire or heat 烧光；烧尽
•Meteorites often burn up in the atmosphere before they reach the Earth.流星常常在到达地球之前就已经在大气层中燃尽了。

UK [bɜ:n] US [bɝ:n] verb (burnt or burned, burnt or burned)  Phrasal Verbs   burn up informal ■to have a bad fever 发高烧
•"You're burning up!" she said, touching his forehead.“你烧得很厉害！”她摸着他的额头说道。

UK [bɜ:n] US [bɝ:n] verb (burnt or burned, burnt or burned)  Phrasal Verbs   burn up with sth ■If you burn up with an emotion, you feel that emotion so strongly that you cannot act in a reasonable way 心中充满…；备受…煎熬
•He was burnt up with jealousy and suspicion.他妒火中烧，满腹狐疑。

UK [bɜ:n] US [bɝ:n] verb (burnt or burned, burnt or burned)  Phrasal Verbs   burn with sth ■If you burn with an emotion, you feel that emotion very strongly 心中充满（情感）；受…煎熬
•They were both burning with desire.他们俩欲火焚身。

UK [bɜ:n] US [bɝ:n] noun countable DAMAGE  损坏  ■a place where fire or heat has hurt or damaged something 烧伤（的痕迹）；烫伤（的痕迹）
•One rescue worker caught in the explosion sustained severe burns.一名营救人员在爆炸中身上多处严重烧伤。

•I noticed a cigarette burn in the carpet.我注意到地毯上有烟头烫出的痕迹。
⇒ See also heartburn;sunburn
UK [bɜ:n] US [bɝ:n] noun countable STREAM  小溪  Scottish  a small stream 小溪




scratch, bruise, bump/lump, cut, burn

scratch: 抓伤；
bruise: 擦伤
bump/lump: 碰伤肿块；
cut: 割伤；
burn: 灼伤；


vt. 燃烧；烧毁， [植保]  [外科] 灼伤；激起…的愤怒
 - combust, overfire
vi. 燃烧；烧毁；发热
 - glow, conflagrate
n. [植保] 灼伤， [外科] 烧伤；烙印
 - brand, scaldy
examples: 英 [bɜːn] 美 [bɜːrn]
v.燃烧；烧着；烧毁；灼伤；急于n.烧伤；燃烧

(1) Half the candle had burnt away.(2) It's better to burn out than to fade away!(3) Paper burns easily.(4) If the satellite returns to earth too fast, it will burn up on the way.(5) He is going to scalp me or burn me at the stake.(6) She is burning to tell you the news.(7) Tell him to put cold water on the burn.(8) He died of the burns he received in the fire.(9) It seems that matter is lost when fuels burn.(10) Coal of this quality doesn't burn very easily.
(1) 蜡烛已烧去一半。(2) 与其慢慢凋谢,不如灿烂燃烧!(3) 纸容易着火。(4) 如果人造卫星返回地球太快,它在归途中就会烧毁了。(5) 他要剥掉我的头皮或是在火刑柱上烧我。(6) 她急于要告诉你这消息。(7) 告诉他,在烧伤处敷凉水。(8) 他因在火灾中受烧伤而死。(9) 似乎燃料燃烧时物质就消失了。(10) 这种品质的煤不容易燃烧。

translation:
vi. 爆裂，炸破; 使爆炸; 充满，塞满; 爆发
vt. 使爆炸; 冲破，胀破; 分帧，分页，分隔
n. 爆炸; 爆裂; 爆发; 突发

时态：burst, bursting, bursts
分布：爆发(28%)，爆裂(18%)，破裂(16%)，阵(15%)，冲(14%)，迸发(6%)，闯(3%)


→词源同break, 破开。
v.爆裂,炸破;突然发生n.突然破裂,爆发They returned in turn to bury the luxuries burnt in the burst.他们依次返回来埋藏在爆炸中烧毁的奢侈品.



US [bɝ:st] verb (burst, burst) IMPROVER  intransitive or transitive ■to break open or apart suddenly, or to make something do this （使）迸裂，（使）爆炸
•Balloons make me nervous - I hate it when they burst.气球令我感到紧张——我讨厌它们突然爆破。

•The river was threatening to burst its banks.河流有决口的危险。

•Suddenly the door burst open (= opened suddenly and forcefully) and police officers carrying guns rushed in.门突然被撞开了，员警端着枪冲了进来。

•figurative humorous If I eat any more cake I'll burst (= I cannot eat anything else) !我再吃蛋糕肚皮就会胀破的！
intransitive ■to feel a strong emotion, or strong wish to do something （心中）充满；心情迫切
•I knew they were bursting with curiosity but I said nothing.我知道他们充满了好奇，但我甚么也没说。

•[+ to infinitive] informal I'm bursting to go to the loo!我急着想上厕所！

•Tom was bursting to tell everyone the news.汤姆迫不及待地想把消息告诉每个人。
burst into flames ■to suddenly burn strongly, producing a lot of flames 突然着火
•Smoke started pouring out from underneath, then the truck burst into flames.烟开始从下面冒了出来，接着卡车便着火了。

UK [bɜ:st] US [bɝ:st] verb (burst, burst)burst at the seams informal ■to be completely full 过满，拥挤不堪
•When all the family come home the house is bursting at the seams.当全家人都回到家里，房子就拥挤不堪。

UK [bɜ:st] US [bɝ:st] verb (burst, burst)burst into song/tears/laughter ■to suddenly begin to sing/cry/laugh 突然开始唱歌／流泪／大笑
•Much to my surprise Ben suddenly burst into song.令我非常惊讶的是，本突然唱起歌来。

UK [bɜ:st] US [bɝ:st] verb (burst, burst)burst out laughing/crying ■to suddenly start laughing/crying 突然大笑／大哭起来
•I walked in and everyone burst out laughing.我走了进去，所有的人都突然放声大笑起来。

UK [bɜ:st] US [bɝ:st] verb (burst, burst)  Phrasal Verbs   burst in/into (somewhere) ■to enter a room or building suddenly and without warning 突然闯入（房间或建筑）
•The side door of the pub flew open and three men burst in.酒吧的侧门猛地开了，三个男人闯了进来。

UK [bɜ:st] US [bɝ:st] verb (burst, burst)  Phrasal Verbs   burst in on sb/sth ■to enter a room suddenly and without warning, interrupting the people or activity inside 突然闯入而打断（或打扰）：
•Katya burst in on him without warning.卡佳连招呼都没打就突然出现在了他面前。

UK [bɜ:st] US [bɝ:st] verb (burst, burst)  Phrasal Verbs   burst out ■to suddenly say something loudly 猛然大叫
•"Don't go!" he burst out.“别走！”他猛然大叫道。

UK [bɜ:st] US [bɝ:st] noun countable BREAK  爆裂  ■when something breaks open and what is inside breaks out 爆裂
•a burst in the water pipe水管爆裂

UK [bɜ:st] US [bɝ:st] noun countable INCREASE  增加  ■a sudden increase in something, especially for a short period （尤指短期的）突然增加；迸发
•a burst of speed/applause/laughter突然的加速／一阵掌声／一阵大笑





explode, erupt, burst

这组词都有“爆炸、爆发”的意思，其区别是：
explode: 指物体爆炸而释放大量热能的一刹那。
erupt: 主要指火山的爆发，也可用作引申意义。
burst: 强调爆炸能量的突然释放和力量的突然迸发。



break, crush, crack, shatter, smash, burst, fracture

这组词都有“打破、弄碎”的意思，其区别是：
break: 常用词，含义广泛，多指猛然用力将坚硬物打破或损坏。
crush: 指用力把东西压破或变形。
crack: 多指因长期使用或经受压力，物体表现呈现裂纹、裂口或破裂、裂开，但一般没成碎片。
shatter: 指破裂为许多支离破碎的碎片，多用指易碎事物。
smash: 指突然而猛烈地重击某物，使之破碎或完全变形。
burst: 指某物因内部外部压力过大而出现严重破裂、爆开或账破。
fracture: 比crack的破裂程度更深更严重，常指断裂，医学上指骨折。



explode, burst, break out

explode: （炸弹）爆炸；
burst: （the ball）爆裂
break out: 爆发（战争）；


vi. [天] 爆发，突发； [力] 爆炸
 - out break, flame up
vt. [天] 爆发，突发； [力] 爆炸
 - blast, out break
n. [天] 爆发，突发； [力] 爆炸
 - blast, outbreak
examples: 英 [bɜːst] 美 [bɜːrst]
n.爆发；破裂；阵v.爆裂；迸发；冲；闯

(1) There was a burst of laughter in the next room.(2) The pipe burst and a spout of water shoot out.(3) Prices went up and up in recent years, before the housing bubble burst.(4) I've eaten so much I'm bursting at the seams.(5) The boy blew the paper bag out and burst it.(6) I felt as if my heart would burst with joy.(7) And then in one climactic burst of sound they surged forward.(8) The police burst through the door.
(1) 隔壁房间里突然爆发出一阵笑声。(2) 水管破裂了，一股水喷了出来。(3) 最近几年价格持续上涨，直到房价泡沫的破裂。(4) 我吃得太多了，肚子都要撑破了。(5) 那男孩把纸袋吹胀后又把它弄破了。(6) 我觉得自己高兴得心花怒放。(7) 突然间纵声大呼，疾冲而出。(8) 警察破门而入。
[sound:youdao-1f056d38-9c7d653f-a9b554f1-c0f5ed3a-2a9fdc58.mp3]

translation:
vt. 埋葬，葬; 为…举行葬礼; 隐藏，埋藏，遮盖，掩蔽; 专心致志于，埋头于，沉溺于
n. 布里

时态：buried, burying, buries
分布：埋葬(94%)，抛弃(3%)，专心致志(2%)，隐匿(1%)


→来自PIE *bhergh, 保护，埋藏。词源同harbor, 港口。
v.埋(葬),安葬;埋藏,遮盖They returned in turn to bury the luxuries burnt in the burst.他们依次返回来埋藏在爆炸中烧毁的奢侈品.



verb transitive  IMPROVER  ■to put a dead body into the ground, or to put something into a hole in the ground and cover it 埋；埋葬，安葬
•His father is buried in the cemetery on the hill.他的父亲葬在山上的墓地里。

•The dog trotted off to bury its bone.那只狗颠儿颠儿地跑到一边去埋它的骨头。

•buried treasure埋藏的财宝
⇒ See also burialusually passive■to cover something or someone completely with a large quantity of something 掩埋，埋藏
•If an avalanche strikes, skiers can be buried alive by snow.如果发生雪崩，滑雪者可能会被雪活埋。
■to put something in a place where it is difficult or impossible to find or see 埋藏，隐藏
•I found the article buried (away) in the business section of the newspaper.我在报纸的商务版找到了这篇文章。

•She buried her face in her hands and began to sob.她双手掩面开始啜泣。
■to intentionally forget an unpleasant experience 埋藏，忘却（不快的经历）
•He'd had to bury his pain over the years.多年来他不得不将痛苦埋在心底。
■old-fashioned ■If someone says they buried someone, usually a close relation, they mean that the person died 失去（亲人）
•She buried both her parents last year.去年她的父母都过世了。

['ber.i] verb transitive bury the hatchet ■to stop an argument and become friends again 言归于好
•Can't you two just bury the hatchet?你们俩难道就不能言归于好吗？




vt. 埋葬；隐藏
 - lock, pocket
examples: 英 ['beri] 美 ['beri]
vt.埋葬；隐匿；专心致志；抛弃

(1) Even if you kill me, even if you bury me, I should rise again.(2) The funeral is tomorrow and they will bury the body after the church service.(3) He likes to bury himself in the country.(4) She had learnt to bury her feelings.(5) You will have to bury yourself in your studies if you want to pass the exam.(6) He was sitting with his head buried in a book.(7) Just bury the hatchet and go have a drink together!
(1) 即使你杀了我(2) 葬礼明天举行，他们会在教堂仪式后埋葬遗体。(3) 他喜欢隐居乡间。(4) 她已经学会了感情不外露。(5) 如果你想通过考试，就得专心致志地学习。(6) 他坐着埋头看书。(7) 别吵了，一起去喝一杯吧！

translation:
n. 灌木（丛）; [机械学]（金属）衬套; [电学]（绝缘）套管; 类似灌木的东西（尤指浓密的毛发或皮毛）
vi. 丛生; 灌木般丛生; 浓密（或茂密）地生长; 生密枝
vt. 加（金属）衬套于; 加套管于; 用耙耙平（耕地）; 以灌木（或灌木丛）装饰（或覆盖、围绕、围住、支撑、标志、保护等）
adj. （豆科植物等）如灌木般长得低矮的; 粗野的; 粗鲁的; 粗糙但实用的

时态：bushed, bushing, bushes
分布：灌木丛(62%)，矮树(23%)，丛生(15%)


→词源不确定。可能来自PIE *bheue, 存在，生长，居住。词源同be. 指灌木顽强的生命力。
n.灌木(丛)His eyebrows bush together.他的眉毛浓密.



noun PLANT  植物   ADVANCED  countable ■a plant with many small branches growing either directly from the ground or from a hard woody stem, giving the plant a rounded shape 灌木
•a rose bush玫瑰丛
countable usually singular ■a large amount of hair 浓密的头发
•The baby was born with a surprising bush of black hair.令人吃惊的是，这个婴儿生下来就长着浓密的黑发。

[bʊʃ] noun AREA OF LAND  一片地  the bush only singular ■(especially in Australia and Africa) an area of land covered with bushes and trees which has never been used for growing crops and where there are very few people （尤指澳大利亚和非洲长满灌木丛和树的）荒野，丛林地




jungle, shrub, bush

这一组词均与树木有关。
jungle: n.热带稠密的雨林或丛林。
shrub: n.有木茎的灌木，灌木丛。
bush: n.矮树丛。


n. [林] 灌木；矮树丛
 - shrub, frutex
vt. 以灌木装饰；使…精疲力竭
 - peter
vi. 丛生；浓密地生长
 - cluster
adj. 如灌木般长得低矮的；粗野的
 - robust, gross, rough, country
examples: 英 [bʊʃ] 美 [bʊʃ]
n.灌木丛；矮树v.丛生；(以灌木)标记、保护、支撑Bush.n.布什(姓氏)

(1) He scrabbled about in the bush for the ball.(2) The rabbit started from the bush.(3) There is some ice in the bush.(4) With a few quick snips of the shears he pruned the bush.(5) The soldier saw a gun jutting out from a bush.(6) I can't pull this bush up, it's firmly rooted in the ground.(7) There are many anecdotes about George Bush.(8) If you cut off some of the branches,the tree would not bush out.(9) They have gone ahead to bush out a safe way across the frozen lake.
(1) 他在灌木丛中爬着到处找球。(2) 野兔从灌木丛中突然窜了出来。(3) 树丛里有些冰。(4) 他用大剪刀几下子就把灌木给修剪好了。(5) 那士兵看见一支枪从矮树丛伸出来。(6) 这棵矮树我拔不起来。它的根在地里生得很牢。(7) 有很多关于布什的有趣的故事。(8) 如果你砍掉一些树枝的话，这棵树就不会枝杈丛生。(9) 他们已到前面去了，在冰封的湖面上用树枝标出一条安全通道。
[sound:youdao-7d1e3037-d56eeaee-658d9f46-1a4d1498-b7d6b1bd.mp3]

translation:
n. 商业，交易; 生意; 事务，业务; 职业，行业

分布：生意(49%)，商业(45%)，事务(6%)


→busy的名词形式。
n.商业,生意;事务,业务,职责On the bus the busy businessman did a business with the buyer.在公共汽车上,忙碌的商人与买主做了一笔生意.



noun SELLING  卖   ESSENTIAL  countable or uncountable ■the activity of buying and selling goods and services, or a particular company that does this, or work you do to earn money 商业；生意；商务；公事；商业机构；公司；商店
•My brother's in business.我哥哥经商。

•He's in the frozen food business.他做冷冻食品生意。

•The two brothers established/set up/started up a clothes retailing business.兄弟俩开了家服装零售商店。

•Our firm does  a lot of business  with overseas customers.我们公司与海外客户的生意往来很多。

•Eventually they found a consultant they felt they could do  business  with (= with whom they could work well).最后他们找到了一个他们觉得可以与其愉快合作的顾问。

•Currently, there are fewer firms in business (= operating) in the area than ever before.目前在该地区经营的公司比以往任何时候都少。

•This new tax will put a lot of small firms out of business (= they will stop operating).这项新的税收将导致许多小企业倒闭。

•She set up in business (= started her own company) as a management consultant.她自己开办公司提供管理咨询服务。

•How is business (= Are you selling much) at the moment?现在生意怎么样？

•Business is good/brisk/booming/flourishing (= I'm selling a lot).生意兴隆。

•Business is bad/slack/quiet (= I'm not selling much).生意清淡。

•I'm in Baltimore on business.我在巴尔的摩出差。

•a business appointment商务会面
  Common Learner Errors   businessWarning:  Choose the right verb!Don't say 'make business', say do business :✗ We have been making business with this company for five years.We have been doing business with this company for five years.
['bɪz.nɪs] noun MATTER  事情   IMPROVER  [S or U] ■a situation or activity, often one that you are giving your opinion about 状况；事，事情；事务；重要事件
•Arranging a trip abroad is a time-consuming business.筹划一趟出国旅行是件很费时的事。

•These killings are a dreadful business.这些谋杀是非常可怕的事。

•I make it my business (= I feel it is my particular duty) to check the monthly accounts.我觉得核查每月账目是我的责任。

•We've got some unfinished business to discuss (= We still have something important to discuss).我们还有一些未了结的事务需要讨论。

['bɪz.nɪs] noun THINGS YOU DO  所做的事情   ADVANCED  uncountable ■the things that you do or the matters which relate only to you 事情；个人事务
•I got on with the  business  of filling in the form.我继续填表格。

•What she does with her life is her business.她如何生活是她自己的事。

['bɪz.nɪs] noun be in business informal ■to be ready and able to start doing something that you planned 准备就绪
•Once we get the computer installed we'll be in business.电脑一安装好我们就可以开始了。

['bɪz.nɪs] noun be none of sb's business ■If something is none of someone's business, they do not need to know about it, although they want to, because it does not affect them 与（某人）无关
•Stop pestering me, it's none of your business!不要再烦我，这件事与你无关！

['bɪz.nɪs] noun be the business UK slang■to be extremely good or skilful 出色
•That new defender is the business!那个新防守队员非常棒！

['bɪz.nɪs] noun (It's) business as usual. saying ■said when things are continuing as they always do, despite a difficult situation （尽管情况困难）一切照常。
['bɪz.nɪs] noun Business before pleasure. saying ■said to emphasize that you believe work is more important than entertainment and enjoyment （用于强调重要性）事业在先，享乐在后。
['bɪz.nɪs] noun do the business informal ■to do what is wanted or needed in a situation 解决问题；把事办成
•As long as he does the business on the football field, the club is happy with him.只要他在足球场上发挥出水准，球会就对他很满意。
 UK slang ■to have sex 性交，上床
['bɪz.nɪs] noun get down to business ■to start talking about the subject to be discussed 进入主题，讨论正题
•If the introductions are over I'd like to get down to business.如果介绍完了，我想开始讨论正题。

['bɪz.nɪs] noun have no business doing sth ■to have no right to do something 无权做…
•You had no business reading my private letters.你无权看我的私人信件。

['bɪz.nɪs] noun like nobody's business ■very quickly or very much 非常快；很多地
•He was scribbling away like nobody's business.他忙着写个不停。

['bɪz.nɪs] noun not be in the business of ■If a person or organization is not in the business of doing something considered wrong, they do not normally do it 不做（错事）
•The intelligence service is not in the business of routinely monitoring the activities of law-abiding citizens.情报机关通常不会监控守法公民的活动。

['bɪz.nɪs] noun What a business! old-fashioned ■used to mean that something was annoying and caused a lot of trouble for you 真麻烦！
•It took ages to sort out the documentation needed to get into the country - what a business!花了好长时间才将入境所需的档整理好——真是件麻烦事！

['bɪz.nɪs] noun   Common Learner Errors   businessWarning: Check your spelling!Business is one of the 50 words most often spelled wrongly by learners.Remember: the correct spelling has 's' in the middle and 'ss' at the end.




deal, trade, bargain, commerce, business

这组词都有“贸易，交易”的意思，其区别是：
deal: 口语用词，指买卖双方经过交涉达成协议成交。
trade: 普通用词，含义广。既可指某种具体的商业又可指广泛的贸易。
bargain: 多指买卖双方通过谈判、协商就商品质量、数量、价格等项达成协议所成的生意。
commerce: 多指大规模的买卖或易货关系。
business: 指包括售货、购货、换货在内的综合商业活动，方式可以是批发或零售。



affair, matter, concern, business, thing

这组词都有“事情”的意思，其区别是：
affair: 含义较广，侧重指已发生或必须去做的任何事情或事务。复数形式多指重大或较复杂的事务。
matter: 普通用词，着重指一件考虑中的或需要处理的事。
concern: 往往强调与个人或团体利害有直接或重大关系的事。
business: 通常指较重要或较难而又必须承担的事情，也可指商事。
thing: 用作“事情”解时，词义较笼统、含糊，多用于指不很具体的事。



substance, affair, matter, business

substance: 具有某种化学物理性质的“物质”
affair: 私事
matter: 泛指一切有形之物的“物质”
business: 商业，生意


n. 商业；生意； [贸易] 交易；事情
 - commerce, thing, trade, affair, truck
examples: 英 ['bɪznəs] 美 ['bɪznəs]
n.商业；事务；生意
(1) He had no head for business.(2) He was inexperienced in business.(3) I don't understand this business.(4) They've done some business together.(5) Business is always brisk before Christmas.
(1) 他毫无商业头脑。(2) 他在商业方面缺乏经验。(3) 我不了解这件事。(4) 他们一起做过生意。(5) 圣诞节前生意总是很兴隆。
[sound:youdao-b2cf1659-ca23f9ad-554e10e9-8c2ab7c0-e84cf16e.mp3]

translation:
conj. 但是; 而是; 除了; 只因为
prep. 除…以外
adv. 只; 不过; 只是; 另一方面
n. 借口; 推辞; 但是; 反对
pron. [关系代词，意义相当于 who…not, which…not]
vt. 对…说“但是”

分布：但是(45%)，只(28%)，仅仅(14%)，无不(9%)，除 ... 以外(4%)


→来自古英语butan。b同by, 在旁。-ut, 同out，向外。
conj.但是prep.除...以外ad.只,才,仅仅I used to abuse the unusual usage, but now I'm not used to doing so.我过去常滥用这个不寻常的用法,但我现在不习惯这样做.



conjunction  ESSENTIAL  ■used to introduce an added statement, usually something that is different from what you have said before 但是，不过；而；相反
•She's very hard-working but not very imaginative.她工作很努力，但缺乏想像力。

•This is not caused by evil, but by simple ignorance.这并不是恶意而为，只是由于无知。

•The play's good, but not that good - I've seen better.这出戏还可以，但也不是多好——我看过更好的。

•I'm sorry, but I think you're wrong when you say she did it deliberately.对不起，但我觉得你不能说她是故意那么做的。

•Call me old-fashioned, but I like handwritten letters.叫我老古董好了，反正我喜欢手写的信。

•I can understand his unhappiness. But to attempt suicide!我可以理解他很不快乐，但自杀有点太极端了吧！

•"She said she's leaving." "But why?"“她说她要走。”“可是为了甚么呢?”

•You can invite Keith to the party, but please don't ask that friend of his.你可以邀请基斯参加聚会，但请不要邀请他的那个朋友。

•We must not complain about the problem, but (= instead we must) help to put it right.我们不应该抱怨问题，而是应该帮助解决问题。

•She's not a painter but a writer (= She is a writer, not a painter).她不是画家而是作家。

•She's not only  a painter but  also a writer (= She is both).她不仅是画家而且是作家。

•He said he hadn't been there, but then (= it is not surprising that) he would say that.他说他没去过那里，不过他那么说也不奇怪。

•I think it's true, but then (= it should be understood that) , I'm no expert.我认为这不假，不过我并非专家。

[strong form bʌt] [weak form bət] preposition conjunction  ESSENTIAL  ■except 除…外
•Eventually, all  but  one of them promised to come to his leaving party.最后，除了一个人外，他们都答应来参加他的告别欢送会。

•He's anything but violent (= not violent in any way).他一点也不粗暴。

•I'd have crashed the car but for your warning.要不是有你的警告，我早就把汽车撞坏了。

•This is the last  episode but  one (= one before the last) of this drama serial.这是这部连续剧的最后第二集。

•She's one of those guests who does nothing but complain.她是那种只知道抱怨的客人。

•This car has been nothing but trouble - it's always breaking down!这辆汽车哪里都有毛病——老是坏！

[strong form bʌt] [weak form bət] adverb FOR EMPHASIS  强调  ■used to give force to a statement （表示强调）
•Everyone, but everyone, will be there.每个人，请注意是每个人，都必须到。

[strong form bʌt] [weak form bət] adverb ONLY  仅仅  formal ■only; just 仅仅，只是
•She's but a young girl!她只是个小女孩！

[strong form bʌt] [weak form bət] noun no buts (about it) ■used to emphasize that something will happen even if the person you are talking to does not want it to 没有“但是”可言；没有商量的余地
•We're going to visit your aunt tomorrow and there'll be no buts about it.我们明天要去看望你的婶婶，一定要去，没有商量的余地。





or else, but, or, but rather

or else: a. 否则，不然；b. 也可能
but: 但是
or: 或者
but rather: 而是



except, but, besides, except for

这组词都有“除……之外”的意思，其区别是：
except: 侧重于排除在外，从整体里减去。可与but换用，但语气较强。
but: 侧重指不包括在内。
besides: 着重于指另外还有。
except for: 多用于在说明基本情况或对主要部分加以肯定，还引出相反的原因或细节，从而部分地修正前面的主要意思，含惋惜意味。



whereas, nevertheless, but, however, still, while, yet

这组词都有“但是，可是，然而，而”的意思，其区别是：
whereas: 表对比，一般可与while互换。
nevertheless: 指尽管作出完全让步，也不会发生任何影响。
but: 口语常用词，语气较强，泛指与前述情况相反。
however: 表转折关系，语气稍弱于but，连接性也弱一些，因而常作插入语。
still: 语气强，多用于肯定句或疑问句。指尽管作出让步，采取措施或表示反对，但情况仍然如故，无所改变。
while: 表对比，一般可与whereas换用，但程度弱一些。
yet: 常用于否定句，语气比still稍强。指不管作出多大努力或让步，仍达不到预期的结果。



shed, cabin, but, cottage

这组词都有“小屋”的意思，其区别是：
shed: 一般指四壁没有完全封闭，供牲畜用或储藏东西、停放车辆等的简易棚屋。
cabin: 多指建造粗糙的简陋小木屋，也指旅客或船员住的船舱。现在也指节假日游游者的简便住房。
but: 多指供居住或遮避风雨的简易小屋。
cottage: 指穷苦人住的乡间小茅屋。现在也指雅致的小住宅，在美国可指别墅。


conj. 但是；而是；然而
 - granted, and, yet, whereas, only
adv. 仅仅，只
 - merely, simply, only, just, barely
prep. 除…以外
 - barring
examples: 英 [bət] 美 [bət]
conj.但是prep.除 ... 以外adv.仅仅；只pron.无不
(1) Our world is but a small part of the cosmos.(2) He's still but a child.(3) I want to say nothing but sorry.(4) He can but admit that it was his fault.
(1) 我们的世界仅仅是宇宙的一小部分而已。(2) 他仅仅是个小孩子。(3) 我只想说对不起。(4) 他只得承认这是他的错误。
[sound:youdao-a1842d5d-eecb1774-cb0ba392-804c9b7f-981dcd71.mp3]

translation:
n. 屠夫，屠户; 屠杀者，刽子手; 残酷的人; 肉铺
vt. 屠宰; 屠杀; 弄砸，弄糟; 把…处死刑

时态：butchered, butchering, butchers
分布：屠夫(66%)，屠宰(14%)，肉商(9%)，刽子手(6%)，小贩(2%)，滥杀(2%)，将某事弄得一团糟(1%)


→来自buck, 雄鹿, 公羊。插入字母t. 卖羊肉的人。
n.屠夫,卖肉者The wretched butcher clutched the needle and stitched it clumsily.可怜的屠夫抓针并且笨拙缝它.
【记】读：不齿。令人不齿的人－刽子手



US [-ɚ] noun countable WORK  工作   ADVANCED  ■a person who sells meat in a shop 肉商，肉贩 ADVANCED  (UK also butcher's) ■a shop where butchers work 肉店，肉铺
UK ['bʊtʃ.ər] US [-ɚ] noun countable MURDER  谋杀  ■someone who murders a lot of people, especially in a cruel way 杀人魔王
UK ['bʊtʃ.ər] US [-ɚ] noun countable have a butcher's UK old-fashioned slang ■to look at something 看一看
•Let's have a butcher's at your present, then.那么，让我们看一看你的礼物。

UK ['bʊtʃ.ər] US [-ɚ] verb transitive ■to cut an animal into pieces of meat 屠宰，宰杀■to kill someone in a very violent way 屠杀，杀戮



vt. 屠杀
 - put to the sword, shed blood
n. 屠夫
 - slaughterer, flesher
examples: 英 ['bʊtʃə(r)] 美 ['bʊtʃər]
n.屠夫；刽子手；肉商；小贩vt.屠宰；滥杀；将某事弄得一团糟

(1) The butcher chopped off a rib of frozen pork.(2) Hitler was as a great a butcher as the world has seen.(3) The butcher will dress the chicken for you.(4) The butcher's shop stank in hot weather.(5) Many western countries raise and butcher a large number of beef cattle.(6) They butchered the war prisoners.(7) Don't butcher that song by singing off key.
(1) 屠夫砍下一块冻肉的肋条。(2) 希特勒是有史以来最大的侩子手。(3) 肉商将为你准备加工好的鸡。(4) 肉铺热天散发出腥臭味。(5) 许多西方国家饲养并屠宰大量的肉牛。(6) 他们残杀战俘。(7) 别唱走调而糟蹋了那首歌。
[sound:youdao-ec5148d8-a002c826-97d7e4bf-318d5519-e2ecaf94.mp3]

translation:
n. 黄油; 黄油状的食品; 奉承话; 焊膏
vt. 抹黄油于…上; 用黄油煎食物; 讨好

时态：buttered, buttering, butters
分布：黄油(67%)，奶油(26%)，奉承(4%)，涂黄油(3%)


→bu, 牛，同bovine. 指牛奶加工后的产物。
n.黄油,奶油v.涂黄油于...上The button utters in mutter, "The butterfly likes the buttered earthnut/peanut."按钮咕哝着发出声音说:"蝴蝶喜欢涂了奶油的花生."



US ['bʌtˌ.ɚ] noun uncountable  ESSENTIAL  ■a pale yellow solid containing a lot of fat that is made from cream and is spread on bread or used in cooking 奶油，牛油
•We were served scones with butter and jam.我们吃的是涂有奶油和果酱的烤饼。

•Have some bread and butter (= bread spread with butter).吃些奶油面包片吧。

•a butter dish奶油碟

UK ['bʌt.ər] US ['bʌtˌ.ɚ] noun uncountable  butter wouldn't melt in sb's mouth ■when someone looks as if they would never do anything wrong, although you feel they might （某人）装老实相
•Tommy looked as if butter wouldn't melt in his mouth.汤美装出一副老实相。

UK ['bʌt.ər] US ['bʌtˌ.ɚ] verb transitive ■to spread butter on something 涂奶油于
UK ['bʌt.ər] US ['bʌtˌ.ɚ] verb transitive   Phrasal Verbs   [M] butter sb up informal ■to be very kind or friendly to someone or try to please them, so that they will do what you want them to do 奉承（某人）；拍（某人的）马屁
•You'll have to butter them up a bit before they'll agree.你得奉承他们一下，他们才会同意。




vt. 涂黄油于；讨好
 - kiss up to, soft-sawder
n. [食品] 黄油；奶油；奉承话
 - cream, beurre
examples: 英 ['bʌtə(r)] 美 ['bʌtər]
n.黄油；奶油vt.涂黄油；奉承

(1) inflict symbolically(2) My mother asked me to cream the butter and sugar together.(3) She cooks omelets in butter as they do in France.(4) She filmed a slice of bread with butter.(5) I'll butter the bread.(6) I've seen you buttering up the boss!
(2) 妈妈让我把黄油和糖搅成奶油状。(3) 她用奶油做法国式的蛋卷。(4) 她涂一层薄薄的奶油在一片面包上。(5) 我会给面包涂上黄油。(6) 我看见你巴结老板来着！
[sound:youdao-470a7232-a2179bd9-b04d58eb-c187d642-7e3dc147.mp3]

translation:
n. 蝴蝶; 蝶泳; 轻浮的人; 游手好闲的人
v. 切开摊平

时态：butterflied, butterflying, butterflies
分布：蝴蝶(89%)，蝶泳(10%)，蝶状物(1%)


→butter, 黄油。fly, 昆虫。形容蝴蝶黄油色的翅膀。
n.蝴蝶The button utters in mutter, "The butterfly likes the buttered earthnut/peanut."按钮咕哝着发出声音说:"蝴蝶喜欢涂了奶油的花生."



US ['bʌtˌ.ɚ-] noun countable INSECT  昆虫   ADVANCED  ■a type of insect with large often brightly coloured wings 蝴蝶
UK ['bʌt.ə.flaɪ] US ['bʌtˌ.ɚ-] noun countable PERSON  人  disapproving■a person who is not responsible or serious, and who is likely to change activities easily or only be interested in pleasure 轻浮多变的人；追求享乐的人
•She's such a social butterfly.她可真是个交际花。

UK ['bʌt.ə.flaɪ] US ['bʌtˌ.ɚ-] noun countable JEWELLERY  首饰  ■the small metal part put on the back of a stud (= piece of jewellery worn in the ear) that keeps it in place 耳环托
UK ['bʌt.ə.flaɪ] US ['bʌtˌ.ɚ-] noun countable SWIMMING  游泳  [S or U] ■the butterfly stroke  蝶泳
UK ['bʌt.ə.flaɪ] US ['bʌtˌ.ɚ-] noun countable have butterflies (in your stomach) informal ■to feel very nervous, usually about something you are going to do （通常指对将要做的事）感到非常紧张，觉得很心慌
•I had terrible butterflies before I gave that talk in Venice.我那次在威尼斯讲话前感到异常紧张。




n. [昆] 蝴蝶；蝶泳；举止轻浮的人；追求享乐的人
 - scalewing, papilio
examples: 英 ['bʌtəflaɪ] 美 ['bʌtərflaɪ]
n.蝴蝶；蝶状物；蝶泳vt.(烹饪时把鱼肉等）切开摊平

(1) A butterfly must not be confused with a moth.(2) A caterpillar is the larva of a butterfly.(3) A butterfly is flying up and down among the flowers.(4) What are the elements of the butterfly stroke?(5) Turn the fish over and butterfly it, before you put it in the oven.
(1) 不得将蝴蝶和飞蛾混同起来。(2) 毛虫是蝴蝶的幼体。(3) 有一只蝴蝶正在花丛里忽上忽下地飞着。(4) 蝶泳的泳姿动作要领是什么?(5) 把鱼翻过来，切开、摊平，然后放到炉子上。

translation:
n. 按钮，电钮; 纽扣，扣子; 扣状物; [植]芽
vt. 用纽扣扣紧; 用纽扣装饰，钉钮扣于; 在…上装钮扣
vi. 扣住; 装有钮扣; 扣上钮扣

时态：buttoned, buttoning, buttons
分布：按钮(93%)，纽扣(5%)，扣上纽扣(1%)，用纽扣装饰(1%)


→butt, 撞，同beat. -on, 小词后缀。
n.纽扣,按钮(开关)v.扣紧;扣上纽扣The button utters in mutter, "The butterfly likes the buttered earthnut/peanut."按钮咕哝着发出声音说:"蝴蝶喜欢涂了奶油的花生."



US ['bʌtˌ-] noun countable ON CLOTHING  衣服上   IMPROVER  ■a small, usually circular object used to fasten something, for example a shirt or coat 钮扣，扣子
•I did up/undid (= fastened/unfastened) the buttons on my blouse.我扣上／解开衬衫上的钮扣。

UK ['bʌt.ən] US ['bʌtˌ-] noun countable ON MACHINE  机器上   IMPROVER  ■a small, sometimes circular object which you press to operate a device or a machine, or an area on a computer screen which looks and acts like one of these 按钮
•He inserted the cassette and pressed the 'play' button.他插入卡式带，按下“播放”按钮。

UK ['bʌt.ən] US ['bʌtˌ-] noun countable at the push of a button ■very easily 轻易地
•You can't expect to get everything you need at the push of a button.你不能指望轻易地得到自己需要的一切。

UK ['bʌt.ən] US ['bʌtˌ-] noun countable right on the button ■exactly correct 非常正确
•She was right on the button when she said I'd regret moving out.她说得太对了，我的确后悔搬了出去。

UK ['bʌt.ən] US ['bʌtˌ-] verb intransitive or transitive ■to fasten something, usually a piece of clothing, using buttons 扣上（…的）钮扣
•Button (up) your coat, it's cold out.把大衣扣上，外面很冷。

UK ['bʌt.ən] US ['bʌtˌ-] verb intransitive or transitive button it informal ■a rude way of telling someone to stop talking 住口，闭嘴
•Button it, OK! I'm trying to think.住口，好嘛！我在想办法了。




n. [电] 按钮；钮扣
 - pushbutton, press-button
vt. 扣住；扣紧；在…上装钮扣
 - infibulate, buckle
vi. 扣住；装有钮扣；扣上钮扣
 - buckle
examples: 英 ['bʌtn] 美 ['bʌtn]
n.纽扣；按钮v.扣上纽扣；用纽扣装饰
(1) One of the buttons has come off my coat.(2) You may stop the machine by pushing this button.(3) It's very warm, he didn't even button his coat.
(1) 我上衣上的一颗扣子掉了。(2) 按下这个按钮你就可以关掉这个机器。(3) 天气很暖和,他甚至都没扣他外衣的钮扣。

translation:
vt. & vi. 购买，购得
n. 交易，买卖; 便宜货
vt. 够支付; 买通; 收买; 贿赂

时态：bought, buying, buys
分布：买(83%)，购买(14%)，收买(1%)，获得(1%)，便宜货(1%)


→词源不详。
vt.买,买得;向...行贿,收买vi.购买东西I need to buy a new dictionary.我要买一本新的字典.



verb (bought, bought)PAY FOR  为…付款   ESSENTIAL  intransitive or transitive ■to get something by paying money for it 买，购买
•Eventually she had saved enough money to buy a small car.她最终存够了买一辆小汽车的钱。

•[+ two objects] He bought his mother some flowers/He bought some flowers for his mother.他给母亲买了些花。

•There are more people buying at this time of the year so prices are high.这个季节购物的人比较多，所以价格高昂。

•The company was set up to buy and sell shares on behalf of investors.成立该公司为的是代表投资者买卖股票。

•I bought my camera from / informal off a friend of mine.我的相机是从一个朋友处买的。
buy sb's silence ■to pay someone, or do something for someone, so that they do not tell anyone something which they know about and which you want to remain secret （为某人做某事或向某人付款以）封住某人的嘴
•What will we have to do to buy her silence?为了封住她的嘴我们该怎么办？

[baɪ] verb (bought, bought)BELIEVE  相信  transitive slang ■to believe that something is true 相信
•She'll never buy that story about you getting lost!她决不会相信你迷路的谎话！

[baɪ] verb (bought, bought)buy time ■to do something in order to be allowed more time 赢得时间；拖延时间
•He tried to buy time by saying he hadn't been well.他试图以身体不适为借口来拖延时间。

[baɪ] verb (bought, bought) sb has bought it slang ■used to say that someone has been killed （某人）被杀，丧生
•"Marvin's bought it!" screamed the sergeant.“马文被杀了！”中士大叫道。

[baɪ] verb (bought, bought)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] buy sth in UK ■to buy something for future use and not because you need it now 预先买进
•We bought in lots of tinned food in case of heavy snow.我们买了许多罐装食品以备大雪时用。

[baɪ] verb (bought, bought)  Phrasal Verbs   buy into sth BELIEVE  disapproving■to completely believe in a set of ideas 完全相信
•I don't buy into all that New Age stuff.我根本不相信那些甚么新思潮。
BUSINESS  ■to buy a part of a business in order to have some control over it 买进某公司的股票以获取对其的部分控制权
•McDowell was trying to buy into the newspaper business.麦克道尔在试图透过收购方式进入报业。

[baɪ] verb (bought, bought)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] buy sb off ■to pay someone so that they do not cause you any trouble 买通，贿赂（某人）
•They tried to buy the guard at the bank off but he told the police and the gang were arrested.那伙人试图买通银行的保安，但保安报了警，于是他们都被抓了起来。

[baɪ] verb (bought, bought)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] buy sb out ■to buy a part of a company or building from someone else so that you own all of it 买断（某人的）股份（或产权）
•Allied Chemicals have been trying to buy out their competitor's share in the target company.联合化工公司一直在试图买下其竞争对手在他们想要收购的公司的股份。

[baɪ] verb (bought, bought)  Phrasal Verbs   [R] buy yourself out UK ■If you buy yourself out of the armed forces, you pay a sum of money so that you can leave earlier than you had previously agreed to. 出钱以获准提前退役
[baɪ] verb (bought, bought)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] buy sth up ■To buy something up is to buy large amounts of it, or all that is available 大量买进，全数买进
•He bought up all the land in the surrounding area.他买下了周围地区的全部土地。

[baɪ] noun a good/bad buy ■to be worth/not be worth the price （买卖）合算／不合算
•This jacket is a really good buy, at £20.这件夹克真合算，才20英镑。





buy, purchase

这组词都有“购买”的意思，其区别是：
buy: 普通日常用词，既可指日常随意购物也可指大的购买。
purchase: 正式用词，指大宗购货或购买重要东西。无感情色彩，强调物品的购得。


vt. 购买；获得；贿赂
 - acquire, earn, purchase, find, make
n. 购买，买卖；所购的物品
 - purchase, commercial transaction
examples: 英 [baɪ] 美 [baɪ]
vt.购买；买；获得；收买；相信vi.买n.购买；便宜货

(1) Money can't buy happiness.(2) I bought him a drink in return for his help.(3) I'd like to buy a strong household bleach.(4) Don't buy a used car from that rogue.(5) They bought peace with their freedom.(6) She tried to buy time by doing a lot of talk.(7) It's nice to know that some people can't be bought.(8) A lot of people just come into the shop without buying.(9) That shirt was a really great buy.
(1) 金钱买不来幸福。(2) 我请他喝酒以酬谢他的帮助。(3) 我想买强力家用漂白剂。(4) 别从那无赖手里买旧车。(5) 他们牺牲自由换取和平。(6) 她企图以滔滔不绝的谈话来拖延时间。(7) 值得高兴的是有些人并不接受贿赂。(8) 有很多人进店但却不购物。(9) 这个衬衫真是便宜货。
[sound:youdao-56e767ef-aecbc00a-02232dd4-9884bb43-ec0aa85f.mp3]

translation:
n. 新娘，即将（或刚刚）结婚的女子; 姑娘

分布：新娘(100%)


→词源同bread, 面包。女人结婚后工作职责之一。比较wife, 词源同weave.
n.新娘Riding on the ridge of the bridge, the proud bride shouts loudly to the cloud.骄傲的新娘骑在桥脊上对着云大声喊.



noun countable  ADVANCED  ■a woman who is about to get married or has just got married 新娘；即将（或刚）结婚的女子
•He returned from New York with his lovely new bride.他和漂亮的新娘一起从纽约回来了。

•The bride and groom posed for pictures outside the church.新娘和新郎在教堂外摆姿势照相。

•As the mother of the bride, I feel obliged to wear something really spectacular.作为新娘的母亲，我得穿戴得华丽一些。




n. 新娘；姑娘，女朋友
 - judy, colleen
examples: 英 [braɪd] 美 [braɪd]
n.新娘

(1) The bride wore a beautiful white dress.(2) We must drink to the health of the bride.(3) The bride brought many dowries to her husband.(4) The bride was given away by her father.(5) I suppose we shall be having some sort of celebration for the bride.
(1) 新娘穿了一身美丽的白色礼服。(2) 我们要为新娘的健康干杯。(3) 新娘带着很多嫁妆给她丈夫。(4) 由父亲把新娘交与新郎。(5) 我想我们还是来为新娘庆贺一番吧。
[sound:youdao-b431d452-c45cc734-224df961-25a9189e-2ab2cdf8.mp3]
